a document to be served on a board or a regional district,
a document to be filed with a board or a regional district, or
a document to be delivered, sent, submitted or otherwise provided to a board or a regional district,

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice by regional district: obligation satisfied if reasonable effort made
bcl:section.bcl:text: If this or another Act requires a regional district, a board or a regional district officer or employee to give notice or to mail, send or deliver a notice, the obligation is satisfied if a reasonable effort was made to mail or otherwise deliver the notice.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations to provide exemptions from Provincial approval requirements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: means a provision in or under this or any other Act that has the effect of requiring approval or consent of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, a minister, the inspector or another official before a regional district bylaw or other action is adopted, is taken or is effective;
means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to approval or consent of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, the Lieutenant Governor in Council,
in relation to approval or consent of a minister, that minister,
in relation to approval or consent of the inspector, the minister responsible for the administration of this Act, and
in relation to approval or consent of another official, the minister responsible for the administration of the provision establishing the approval requirement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this or any other Act, the responsible authority may, by regulation, provide exemptions from an approval requirement.

A regulation under this section may provide that an exemption is or may be made subject to the terms and conditions specified by the minister responsible or by a person designated by name or title in the regulation.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Regional Districts: Treaty First Nation Membership and Services

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Treaty first nation membership in regional district

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a final agreement provides for the membership of the treaty first nation in a regional district,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: this Act, as modified by this Part, applies to the treaty first nation as a member as if the treaty first nation were a municipality in the regional district, and
the treaty first nation director has the same functions, powers, duties and obligations, as modified by this Part, as a municipal director.

bcl:text.#text: For certainty, to the extent that the  applies to a regional district of which a treaty first nation is a member or to a director as a member of the board, the  applies to the treaty first nation as a member of the regional district and to the treaty first nation director as a member of the board.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Interpretation rules for applying this Act and the  in relation to treaty first nation membership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following apply for the purpose of applying the provisions of this Act or the regulations under this Act in relation to the participation of a treaty first nation as a member of a regional district:

bcl:text.#text: a reference to "municipality" within the meaning of paragraph (a) of its definition in the Schedule to the  must be read as a reference to the treaty first nation;
a reference to "municipality" within the meaning of paragraph (b) of its definition in the Schedule to the  must be read

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as a reference to the treaty lands of the treaty first nation, and
if the reference is in relation to a regional district, as a reference to the portion of those treaty lands that are within the boundaries of the regional district;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reference to "council" must be read as a reference to the governing body of the treaty first nation;
a reference to "municipal director" must be read as a reference to the treaty first nation director of the treaty first nation;
a reference to "municipal participating area" must be read as a reference to a treaty first nation participating area of the treaty first nation;
a reference to "mayor" must be read as a reference to the head of the treaty first nation;
a reference to a bylaw of a municipality must be read as a reference to a law of the treaty first nation;

a reference to "official community plan" must be read as a reference to the land use plan that has the same or similar purposes in relation to the treaty first nation's treaty lands as an official community plan has in relation to a municipality;

bcl:text.#text: the references to "municipal corporate officer" in sections 197 (3)  and 200 (5)  must be read as references to the officer or employee designated by the treaty first nation for the purposes of giving notice to the regional district corporate officer under those sections.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of applying the provisions of this Act or the regulations under this Act in relation to the participation of a treaty first nation as a member of a regional district, references to "local government" do not include treaty first nations except in the following:

bcl:text.#text: the following provisions of Part 3 :
section 57 ;
section 58 ;
section 81 (2) (b) ;
section 112 ;
Division 10 ;
Division 12 ;
Division 15 ;
Division 17 ;
the following provisions of Part 4 :
Division 2 ;
Division 3 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [treaty first nation electors: participating area approval]
bcl:text.#text: Except as provided in section 256 (2) , for the purpose of applying provisions of the  to a regional district of which a treaty first nation is a member, a reference to "elector" in relation to the treaty first nation and its treaty lands must be read as a reference to individuals who would be qualified to register as a resident elector or non-resident property elector of the treaty lands of that treaty first nation if the treaty lands were a municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regional district letters patent and treaty lands

bcl:text: If the final agreement of a treaty first nation provides for membership of the treaty first nation in a regional district on a specified date, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may issue letters patent to
effective on the specified date.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include in the regional district the treaty first nation and all or the portion of the treaty lands that, before the effective date of the final agreement, were within the boundaries of the regional district, and
subject to this Act, do everything necessary to enable that membership in accordance with the final agreement,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If on a specified date referred to in subsection (1) the letters patent for the applicable regional district have not been amended or reissued, the letters patent are deemed amended to include the treaty lands described in subsection (1) (a).

If the final agreement of a treaty first nation contemplates membership of a treaty first nation in a regional district but does not specify when the membership begins, the Lieutenant Governor in Council, on the request of the treaty first nation and after consulting with the affected regional district, may issue letters patent to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: include in the regional district the treaty first nation and all or the portion of the treaty lands of the treaty first nation, as contemplated by the final agreement, and
subject to this Act, do everything necessary to enable that membership in a manner consistent with the final agreement.

bcl:text: If
the Lieutenant Governor in Council, by letters patent, may amend the boundaries of the regional district to exclude those treaty lands.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final agreement of a treaty first nation provides that the treaty lands of the treaty first nation do not form part of any regional district or electoral area, and
the boundaries of a regional district include those treaty lands,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, on the effective date of a final agreement described in subsection (4) (a), letters patent of an affected regional district have not been issued under subsection (4) to exclude the treaty lands, the letters patent of the regional district are deemed amended to exclude those treaty lands.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Treaty first nation directors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a treaty first nation is a member of a regional district, the board of the regional district consists of municipal directors, treaty first nation directors and electoral area directors.

in:desc: [weighted votes for municipalities and electoral areas]
bcl:text.#text: For certainty, sections 196  and 197  apply for the purpose of determining the number of directors and votes to which a treaty first nation is entitled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A treaty first nation must appoint a director to a board from among the elected members of its governing body.

bcl:text.#text: To be eligible for appointment under subsection (3), the person must be qualified to hold office as a member of a local government in accordance with section 81 .
Section 82 (2) (a) and (3) (b)  does not apply in relation to a person referred to in subsection (3) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Term of office of treaty first nation director

bcl:text.in:desc: [appointment and term of office of municipal directors]
bcl:text.#text: Section 198 (2)  does not apply in relation to a treaty first nation director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The term of office of a treaty first nation director

bcl:text.#text: begins when the person takes office in accordance with section 202 (3) , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: continues until the earliest of the following occurs:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: another director takes office in the original director's place;
the director ceases to be an elected member of the governing body of the treaty first nation before the end of the director's term of office as a member of that body;

bcl:text.#text: the director ceases to be qualified to hold office under section 81 ;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the director's term of office as a member of the governing body of the treaty first nation ends.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Alternate treaty first nation director

bcl:text.#text: Section 200 (1)  does not apply in relation to a treaty first nation.
A treaty first nation may appoint as an alternate director an elected member of its governing body who is qualified to hold office as a member of a local government in accordance with section 81 .
Section 82 (2) (a) and (3) (b)  does not apply in relation to the elected member appointed under subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Treaty first nation electors for regional district services

bcl:text.#text: For the purposes of the application of Part 4  in relation to the membership of a treaty first nation in a regional district,
section 172  does not apply, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: individuals may vote if they

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are qualified to do so under a law of the treaty first nation enacted for the purposes of this section, and
register in accordance with that law.

bcl:text.#text: For the purpose of obtaining participating area approval by alternative approval process within treaty lands, individuals may submit a response as an elector under section 86 of the  if they are qualified to vote under the law referred to in subsection (1) (b) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax base, requisition and collection of funds for treaty lands

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies only in relation to the treaty lands of treaty first nations that are not taxing treaty first nations.

bcl:text.#text: Except as provided in this section, Division 3  of Part 11  does not apply in relation to the requisition and collection of taxes in treaty lands.
Section 384 (1), (5) and (6)  applies in relation to a treaty first nation participating area as if the treaty first nation participating area were an electoral participating area.

On or before April 10 in each year, the designated regional district officer must send to the minister charged with the administration of the  a requisition in respect of each service stating the amount required during the year in respect of each treaty first nation participating area.
The amounts requisitioned under subsection (4) may be paid by the minister charged with the administration of the  from the consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a requisition is delivered under subsection (4), the amount requisitioned must be collected by the government as follows:

bcl:text.#text: in the case of an amount that is to be recovered by means of a property value tax, by imposing the tax within the treaty first nation participating areas in accordance with the , using the applicable tax base authorized under section 384  of this Act as it applies under subsection (3) of this section;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an amount that is to be recovered by means of a parcel tax, by imposing the tax on the appropriate parcels within the treaty first nation participating areas, on the basis of the parcel tax roll under subsection (7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a parcel tax is to be imposed under this section,

bcl:text.#text: the board must, by bylaw, provide for the preparation of a parcel tax roll for the service area, and for these purposes Division 4  of Part 7 of the  applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authenticated parcel tax roll for the tax must be forwarded to the Surveyor of Taxes before February 28 in each year, and

bcl:text.#text: the authenticated parcel tax roll is to be used as the basis for the tax, subject to any deletions required to reflect deletions from the supplementary roll used under the .

An amount to be recovered under subsection (6) must be imposed by the government as if it were a tax, and the  and the provisions of that Act respecting assessment, levy, collection and recovery of taxes and the addition of penalties and interest on unpaid taxes apply to taxes imposed under this section.

bcl:text.in:desc: [property under creditor may be excluded from apportionment]
bcl:text.#text: For the purpose of applying section 382  in relation to property taxation within treaty lands, in order to be effective for the requisition in the current year, the board must make an exclusion referred to in section 382 (2) before the requisition for that year in respect of the eligible service is sent to the minister under subsection (4) of this section.

bcl:text.in:desc: [special fees and charges to be collected as taxes — notice to Surveyor of Taxes]
bcl:text.#text: Section 399 (2) (b)  does not apply in relation to a treaty first nation, but a statement referred to in that section must be sent to the Surveyor of Taxes in respect of any amount referred to in section 399 (1) in relation to the treaty lands of the treaty first nation.
Section 399 (4)  does not apply in relation to treaty lands.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax base, requisition and collection of funds for treaty lands of taxing treaty first nations

bcl:text.#text: Section 384 (1) and (4)  does not apply in relation to property taxes within the treaty lands of a taxing treaty first nation.

If a requisition is delivered to a taxing treaty first nation under section 385  of this Act, except as provided in subsection (4) of this section, the amount requisitioned must be collected by the taxing treaty first nation as follows:

in the case of an amount that under a bylaw must be recovered by means of a property value tax, by imposing the tax in accordance with Division 3  of Part 7 of the , as that Part applies in relation to a tax referred to in section 197 (1) (b) of that Act, using the applicable tax base authorized under section 384 (2) of this Act;

in the case of an amount that under a bylaw must be recovered by means of a parcel tax, by imposing the tax on the appropriate parcels within the treaty first nation participating areas of the taxing treaty first nation in accordance with Division 4  of Part 7 of the ;

in the case of an amount to which neither paragraph (a) nor (b) of this subsection applies or an amount for a service for which no establishing bylaw is required, if the taxing treaty first nation imposes a property tax within its treaty lands specifically for the purpose of raising the amount of a requisition, by imposing a property value tax on the basis of the net taxable value of land and improvements in the treaty first nation participating areas as if the tax were a tax referred to in section 197 (1) (b) of the .

bcl:text: In the circumstances described in subsection (2) (a) or (c), the taxing treaty first nation must set out separately on a tax notice given to the owner
in relation to the specific requisition.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of the taxes imposed, and
the rate at which the taxes are imposed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a requisition is received by a taxing treaty first nation under section 385 and subsection (2) of this section does not apply, the taxing treaty first nation need only comply with section 385 (2).

bcl:text.in:desc: [special fees and charges to be collected as taxes]
bcl:text.#text: Section 399 (2) to (5)  does not apply in relation to fees, charges and other amounts described in section 399 (1) that are payable in relation to treaty lands.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If fees, charges and other amounts described in section 399 (1) are owed by a person in relation to the treaty lands of a taxing treaty first nation and not paid on or before December 31 in the year in which they are incurred, the regional district financial officer must send an invoice to the treaty first nation on or before April 10 in the next taxation year and section 385 (2) applies as if the invoice were a requisition for the current year.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Treaty first nations and regional district financing

bcl:text.#text: Despite section 412 (1) ,
section 410  does not apply in relation to treaty first nations,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a treaty first nation director may not vote on a bylaw referred to in section 410 (2), and
for certainty, a treaty first nation is not liable for regional district borrowing under section 410.

bcl:text.#text: Section 412 (2)  does not apply in relation to a default of a treaty first nation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Services to treaty first nation members

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if the final agreement of a treaty first nation provides that, on becoming a member of a regional district, the treaty first nation will participate in specified regional district services.

If a specified service is provided under letters patent, those letters patent are deemed amended to include the treaty first nation as participating in that service and the treaty lands of that treaty first nation as a participating area of that service.

If a specified service is provided under a bylaw, that bylaw is deemed amended to include the treaty first nation as participating in that service and the treaty lands of that treaty first nation as a participating area of that service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Services to treaty lands outside regional district

bcl:text.in:desc: [consent required for services outside regional district]
bcl:text.#text: Section 333 (1) (a) and (4) (a)  does not apply to the establishment and operation of a service in the treaty lands of a treaty first nation that are outside a regional district if the treaty first nation is a member of the regional district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a service is provided both inside and outside the regional district to the treaty lands of a treaty first nation that is a member of the regional district, the treaty lands receiving the service must be treated as one participating area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Non-member treaty first nation participation in regional district elections

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a treaty first nation only if the treaty first nation's final agreement provides that residents of the treaty lands of the treaty first nation may vote in elections for electoral area directors.

bcl:text: If a treaty first nation is not a member of any regional district, individuals who
may continue to vote in electoral area director elections unless an order under subsection (3) provides otherwise.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: would have been qualified to vote in elections for an electoral area director prior to the effective date of the treaty first nation's final agreement, and
after that date, would not be qualified to vote in those elections but for the provision of the final agreement referred to in subsection (1)

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the recommendation of the minister after consultation with the affected local government and the treaty first nation, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may specify, by order, for the purposes of voting in electoral area director elections, in which electoral area individuals may vote who would not qualify to vote in those elections but for the provision of the final agreement referred to in subsection (1).
For the purposes of voting in elections referred to in this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: treaty lands are deemed to be within the applicable electoral area, and
individuals referred to in subsection (2) or in an order under subsection (3) must be qualified to register as a resident elector or non-resident property elector of that applicable electoral area.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Regional Districts: General Powers and Responsibilities

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Corporate powers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the specific limitations and conditions established under this or another Act, the corporate powers of a board include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to make agreements respecting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the regional district's services, including agreements respecting the undertaking, provision and operation of those services, other than the exercise of the board's regulatory authority,
operation and enforcement in relation to the board's exercise of its regulatory authority, and
the management of property or an interest in property held by the regional district;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to make agreements with a public authority respecting

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: activities, works or services within the powers of a party to the agreement, other than the exercise of regulatory authority, including agreements respecting the undertaking, provision and operation of activities, works and services,
operation and enforcement in relation to the exercise of regulatory authority within the powers of a party to the agreement, and
the management of property or an interest in property held by a party to the agreement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to provide assistance for the purpose of benefiting the community or any aspect of the community;
to acquire, hold, manage and dispose of land, improvements, personal property or other property, and any interest or right in or with respect to that property;

bcl:text.#text: to delegate its powers, duties and functions, in accordance with Division 7  of Part 6 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to engage in commercial, industrial and business undertakings and incorporate a corporation or acquire shares in a corporation for that purpose;
to establish commissions to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: operate regional district services,
undertake operation and enforcement in relation to the board's exercise of its regulatory authority, and
manage property or an interest in property held by the regional district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In exercising its powers under subsection (1), a board may establish any terms and conditions it considers appropriate.
The powers of a board under subsection (1) may be exercised outside the boundaries of the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister approval required for certain out-of-Province or out-of-country agreements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An agreement between a board and a public authority in another province respecting the provision and operation of works and services has no effect unless it is approved by the minister.

An agreement between a board and a public authority in another country respecting the provision and operation of works and services has no effect unless it is approved by the Lieutenant Governor in Council.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inspector approval required for incorporation or acquisition of corporations

bcl:text: A regional district may only
with the approval of the inspector or as authorized by regulation.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: incorporate a corporation other than a society, or
acquire shares in a corporation

bcl:text.#text: An incorporation or acquisition under subsection (1) applies as an exception to the restriction under section 183  of the  as that section applies under section 377  of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Public access to regional district records

bcl:link.in:doc: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

bcl:text.#text: In addition to the public access provided by the , a board may, by bylaw, provide for public access to its records and establish procedures respecting that access.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an enactment requires that a regional district record be available for public inspection, that obligation is met by having the record available for public inspection at the regional district offices during regular office hours.

bcl:text.#text: If a regional district record is available for public inspection, a person may have a copy made of all or part of the record on payment of any applicable fee the board establishes under section 397 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person inspecting a record of a regional district must not, without authorization, remove the record from the place where it has been provided for inspection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disclosure of information relating to agreements that require elector approval or assent

bcl:text: If an agreement is proposed or made in relation to a matter that requires approval of the electors or assent of the electors,
must be available for public inspection at the regional district offices during the time when the approval or assent process is underway.

bcl:text.#text: If approval of the electors is required under this Act or the  in relation to a proposed regional district bylaw, agreement or other matter, that approval may be obtained by either

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: assent of the electors, or

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definition of "assistance"

bcl:text.#text: For the purposes of section 263 (1) (c)  and this Division,  means providing a grant, benefit, advantage or other form of assistance, including

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any form of assistance referred to in section 272 (1), and
an exemption from a tax, fee or charge.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Publication of intention to provide certain kinds of assistance

bcl:text.#text: A board must publish, in accordance with section 94  of the , notice of its intention to provide any of the following assistance:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: disposing of land or improvements, or any interest or right in or with respect to them, for less than market value;
lending money;
guaranteeing repayment of borrowing or providing security for borrowing;
assistance under a partnering agreement.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice must be published before the assistance is provided and must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the intended recipient of the assistance, and
the nature, term and extent of the proposed assistance.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General prohibition against assistance to business

bcl:text.#text: As a limitation on section 263 (1) (c) , a board must not provide assistance to an industrial, commercial or business undertaking.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exception for assistance under partnering agreements

bcl:text.#text: Despite section 273 and in addition to the power under section 263 (1) (c) , a board may provide assistance under a partnering agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exception for assistance in relation to utilities, mountain resorts or high-speed internet services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 273, a regional district may operate the service of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing capital financing for services provided by a telephone, natural gas or electric power utility,

bcl:text.#text: the giving of grants to an applicant for a business promotion scheme under section 215  of the  in relation to a mountain resort, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing capital financing for high-speed internet service to an area without access to high-speed internet service.

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  has the meaning prescribed by regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exception for heritage conservation purposes

bcl:text.#text: A board may provide assistance for one or more of the purposes referred to in section 25 (2)  of the .
A board may, by an affirmative vote of at least 2/3 of the votes cast, provide assistance for the conservation of property referred to in section 25 (3)  of the .
The powers under this section are in addition to the power under section 263 (1) (c)  and apply despite section 273 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Limitation on assistance by means of tax exemption

bcl:text.#text: As a limitation on sections 263 (1) (c)  and 274 , a board may provide a property tax exemption only in accordance with Division 4  of Part 11 .

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Reservation and dedication of land for public purpose: application of

bcl:text.#text: Section 30  of the  applies to regional districts.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Control of Crown land parks dedicated by subdivision

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If land outside a municipality is dedicated to the public for the purpose of a park or a public square by a subdivision plan deposited in the land title office, by which title is vested in the Crown, the regional district in which it is located is entitled to possession and control of the land for that purpose.

bcl:text.#text: If land referred to in subsection (1) was dedicated as referred to in that subsection before July 1, 1957, being the date on which the , S.B.C. 1957, c. 42, came into force, the regional district is deemed to have had possession and control of it for that purpose from the date it was dedicated, and continues to have that possession and control.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposition of regional parks and trails

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regional district may, by bylaw adopted with the approval of the electors,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sell a regional park or regional trail, or
exchange a regional park or regional trail for other land to be used for park purposes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The regional district must place the proceeds of a sale under subsection (1) (a) to the credit of a reserve fund established for the purpose of acquiring regional parks or regional trails.
All land taken in exchange under subsection (1) (b) is dedicated for the purpose of a park and title to that land vests in the regional district.
Transfers of land under this section have effect free of any dedication to the public for the purpose of a park.

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Exchange of park land: application of

bcl:text.in:desc: [exchange or other disposal of park land]
bcl:text.#text: Section 27  of the  applies to land
referred to in section 279  of this Act,

bcl:text.in:desc: [park land in place of development cost charges]
bcl:text.#text: vested in a regional district under section 567 (5) (a)  of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All land taken in exchange under this section is dedicated for the purpose of a park or public square, and title to that land vests as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of land referred to in subsection (1) (a), in the Crown with right of possession and control in the regional district;
in the case of land referred to in subsection (1) (b) or (c), in the regional district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transfer under this section of land referred to in subsection (1) (a) has effect as a Crown grant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Power to accept property on trust

bcl:text.#text: Without limiting section 263 , a board may accept any property devised, bequeathed, conveyed or otherwise transferred to the regional district, subject to any trusts on which the property is transferred.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the sale of property is necessary to carry out the terms of a trust under which it was transferred, a board may sell the property despite any limitations or restrictions in this Act.

bcl:text.#text: All money held by a regional district subject to a trust must, until required for the purposes of the trust, be invested in accordance with section 183  of the  as that section applies under section 377 (1)  of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, in the opinion of a board, the terms or trusts imposed by a donor, settlor, transferor or will-maker are no longer in the best interests of the regional district, the board may apply to the Supreme Court for an order under subsection (5).

On an application under subsection (4), the Supreme Court may vary, by order, the terms or trusts that the court considers will better further both the intent of the donor, settlor, transferor or will-maker and the best interests of the regional district.

bcl:text.#text: Section 87  of the  applies to an order under subsection (5).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Plans respecting use of local government right of way
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board may require a person using a local government right of way other than a highway to provide the regional district, if reasonably possible, with accurate plans and profiles of any of the person's works and facilities using the right of way.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposition of land and improvements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), if a board intends to dispose of land or improvements, it must make the land or improvements available to the public for acquisition.
The requirement under subsection (1) does not apply if the disposition is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to a not-for-profit corporation,
to a public authority,
to a person who, as part of the consideration for the disposition, will exchange land or an improvement with the regional district,
to a person under a partnering agreement that has been the subject of a process involving the solicitation of competitive proposals, or
a disposition of land to an owner of adjoining land for the purpose of consolidating the lands.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of proposed disposition

bcl:text.#text: A board intending to dispose of land or improvements must publish notice of its intention in accordance with section 94  of the  and subsection (2) or (3) of this section, as applicable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the disposition is a disposition referred to in section 285 (2), the notice must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the land or improvements,
the person or public authority who is to acquire the property under the proposed disposition,
the nature and, if applicable, the term of the proposed disposition, and
the consideration to be received by the regional district for the disposition.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For all other dispositions, the notice must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a description of the land or improvements,
the nature and, if applicable, the term of the proposed disposition, and
the process by which the land or improvements may be acquired.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Use of money from sale of land or improvements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), all money received by a regional district from the sale of land or improvements must be placed to the credit of a reserve fund.

If, after money is received under subsection (1), a debt incurred by the regional district for the purchase or management of the land or improvements remains, there must be set aside all or part of the proceeds of the disposition, as required to repay the debt as it matures together with interest.

Except as required by subsection (2), in the case of a sale of park land, a regional park or a regional trail, the proceeds of the disposition must be placed to the credit of a reserve fund established for the purpose of acquiring park lands.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposal of water systems, sewer systems and utilities

bcl:text.#text: As a limitation on section 263 (1) (d) , the following works may be disposed of only in accordance with this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: works for the supply, treatment, conveyance, storage and distribution of water;
works for the collection, conveyance, treatment and disposal of sewage;
works for the supply and distribution of gas or electrical energy;
works for a transportation system, telephone system, closed circuit television system or television rebroadcasting system.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The works may be disposed of only if at least one of the following applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the works are no longer required for the purpose described;
the works are disposed of to a municipality in the regional district;
in the case of works referred to in subsection (1) (a) or (b) that are used by the regional district to provide a water or sewer service,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: before the disposition occurs, there is in effect an agreement under which the water or sewer service will continue for a period specified in the agreement, and
the intended disposition receives the assent of the electors;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of works not referred to in paragraph (c), the board has obtained the approval of the electors in relation to the proposed disposition.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (c) (ii),

bcl:text.#text: the notice under section 176  must include a description of the agreement referred to in subsection (2) (c) (i), and
section 267  applies to that agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Expropriation power

bcl:text.#text: For the purpose of exercising or performing its powers, duties and functions, a regional district may expropriate real property or works, or an interest in them, in accordance with the .
Without limiting subsection (1), in addition to the rights conferred on licensees under sections 32 and 33 of the , a regional district may expropriate

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a licence authorizing the diversion of water from a stream or an aquifer that is suitable for a water supply for the regional district, and
any work constructed or used under the authority of the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The powers under subsections (1) and (2) also apply to property outside the regional district for the purposes of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a service provided by the regional district to an area outside the regional district, or
establishing and managing quarries, sand pits or gravel pits to acquire material for regional district works.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority in relation to services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting section 289, a regional district may, for the purposes of one or more of its services, enter on, break up, alter, take or enter into possession of and use real property.

If a regional district exercises an authority to provide a service outside the regional district, the power under subsection (1) applies to property outside the regional district in relation to that service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Entry on land to mitigate damage

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a board considers that real property may be injuriously affected by the exercise of a board power, the regional district may enter on real property and undertake works of construction, maintenance or repair in mitigation of injury done or anticipated, or in reduction of compensation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Compensation for expropriation and other actions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless expressly provided otherwise, if a regional district expropriates real property or works under this or any other enactment, compensation is payable to the owners, occupiers or other persons interested in the property for any damages necessarily resulting from the exercise of those powers beyond any benefit that the person claiming the compensation may derive from the work resulting from the expropriation.

bcl:text.#text: exercises a power referred to in paragraph (a) that does not constitute an expropriation within the meaning of the ,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2), compensation must be paid as soon as practicable in an amount set

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by agreement between the person claiming the compensation and the regional district, or
if no agreement is reached, by the Supreme Court.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Board may seek regional district opinion

bcl:text.#text: Without limiting section 336 , a board may seek the opinion of the electors of the regional district on a question that the board considers affects the regional district, by voting or another process the board considers appropriate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a board seeks an opinion under this section, the board must seek the opinion of the electors of the entire regional district.
The results of a process under this section are not binding on the board.
The board is responsible for conducting the voting or other process under this section.

bcl:text.#text: The seeking of an opinion under this section is general administration within the meaning of section 338 (2) (a) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Incidental powers
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board has all necessary power to do anything incidental or conducive to the exercise or performance of any power, duty or function conferred on a board or regional district by this or any other enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Emergency powers

bcl:text.#text: If the powers conferred on a board are inadequate to deal with an emergency that is not an emergency within the meaning of the , the board may, by bylaw adopted by at least 2/3 of the votes cast, declare that an emergency exists and exercise powers necessary to deal effectively with the emergency.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional powers and exceptions provided by regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite this or any other Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation, do one or more of the following in relation to a specified regional district or a described class of regional districts:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide a power, including a power to regulate, prohibit and impose requirements;
provide that a power conferred under paragraph (a) may be exercised only as a regulatory service;
provide an exception to or a modification of a requirement or condition established by an enactment;
establish any terms and conditions the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers appropriate regarding a power, modification or exception under this section;
authorize a minister to establish any terms and conditions the minister considers appropriate regarding a power, modification or exception under this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As restrictions, a regulation under this section may not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: override an absolute prohibition contained in an enactment;
confer an authority to impose a new tax;
confer an authority to grant a new tax exemption;

eliminate a requirement for obtaining the assent of the electors, unless that requirement is modified by replacing it with a requirement for obtaining approval of the electors by alternative approval process.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority requires regional district service

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This Division applies to a regional district only if the regional district provides a service in relation to building inspection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Building regulation bylaws

bcl:text.#text: Subject to the , the , the  and the regulations under those Acts, the board may, for the purposes described in subsection (2), by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate the construction, alteration, repair or demolition of buildings and other structures;

regulate the installation, alteration or repair of plumbing including septic tanks and sewer connections, heating, air conditioning, electrical wiring and equipment, gas or oil piping and fittings, appliances and accessories of every kind;

require contractors, owners or other persons to obtain and hold a valid permit from the board, or the authorized official, before starting and during the construction, installation, repair or alteration of gas or oil pipes and fittings, plumbing, heating, sewers, septic tanks, drains, electrical wiring, oil burners, tanks, pumps and similar works and buildings and other structures of the kind, description or value described in the bylaw;

require that, before occupancy of a building or part of it after construction, wrecking or alteration, or a change in class of occupancy of a building or part of it, an occupancy permit be obtained from the board or the authorized official;
establish conditions generally governing the issue and validity of permits and the inspection of works, buildings and other structures;
establish areas to be known as fire limits and, for those areas,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: regulate the construction of buildings in respect of precautions against fire, and
discriminate and differentiate between areas in the character of the buildings permitted;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate the seating arrangements and capacity of churches, theatres, halls and other places of public resort or amusement;
regulate or prohibit the moving of a building from one property to another in the regional district;
require the fencing of private swimming pools or other pools, existing or prospective, according to specifications set out in the bylaw;
regulate the construction and layout of trailer courts, manufactured home parks and camping grounds and require that those courts, parks and grounds provide facilities specified in the bylaw;
provide that a trailer or manufactured home must not be occupied as a residence or an office unless its construction and facilities meet the standards specified in the bylaw;
require the installation of smoke alarms in existing buildings and other structures and, in relation to this, establish standards and specifications for required smoke alarms and their installation;

require the maintenance of smoke alarms installed as required by the Provincial building regulations or by bylaw under paragraph (l) and, in relation to this, establish standards for their maintenance;

bcl:text.#text: require the maintenance of "rental units" and "residential property", as defined in the , that are subject to a "tenancy agreement" as defined in that Act, in accordance with the standards specified in the bylaw;

require the maintenance of "manufactured homes", "manufactured home sites" and "manufactured home parks", as defined in the , that are subject to a "tenancy agreement" as defined in that Act, in accordance with the standards specified in the bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may exercise the powers conferred by subsection (1) for the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provision of access to a building or other structure, or to part of a building or other structure, for a person with disabilities;
the conservation of energy or water;
the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions;
the health, safety or protection of persons or property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If requested by an applicant, the building inspector must give written reasons for the building inspector's refusal to issue a building permit required under this section.
An occupancy permit required under subsection (1) (d) may be withheld until the building or part of it complies with the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Provincial building regulations;
bylaws under this section;
any other health and safety requirements established by bylaw;
any other federal or Provincial enactment in relation to health or safety.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regional district may adopt national codes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: To the extent not inconsistent with this Act, either in place of or supplementary to regulating provisions made under another section of this Division, the board may, by bylaw, adopt one or more of the following:

bcl:text.#text: subject to the , all or part of the Canadian Electrical Code;
subject to the , all or part of the standards of the Canadian Gas Association;
subject to the , all or part of the National Fire Code of Canada.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A code, standard or part referred to in subsection (1) may be adopted by reference to a particular date of issue or a specified issue of the code or standard.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirement for security

bcl:text.#text: This section applies if, under section 335 (3) , the board or an official authorized by the board requires a person to provide security as a condition of
issuing a permit under section 298 , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorizing the moving of a building under section 298.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The person who is subject to the requirement may, at that person's option, provide the security by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a cash deposit,
an irrevocable letter of credit, or
another form of security satisfactory to the board or the person who imposed the requirement for security.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Interest on the security becomes part of the security.

bcl:text: The security may be used by the regional district only to repair or replace
that has been altered or damaged by an activity related to the subject matter of the permit or authorization.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a highway, including sidewalks and boulevards,
a public work, or
other regional district property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any amount of the security that is not required for a purpose referred to in subsection (4) must be returned to the person who provided it.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulating doors and emergency exits in public buildings

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means a church, theatre, hall or other place of public resort or amusement.

Subject to the  and the regulations under that Act, the board may, by bylaw, require the provision of and regulate the location, number, style and size of doors and emergency exits in public buildings, and the posting in them of notices of the emergency exits.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw under subsection (2) must provide that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all doors in public buildings must be hinged so that they may open freely outwards, and

all gates or outer fences, if not hinged as referred to in paragraph (a), must be kept open by proper fastenings during the time the buildings are publicly used to facilitate the exit of people in case of alarm from fire or other cause.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Congregations having corporate powers, trustees holding churches or buildings used for churches, and incumbents and church wardens holding or using churches or buildings used for churches, are severally liable for the acts and omissions of any society or congregation on the matters referred to in subsections (2) and (3).
A person owning or possessing a public building who contravenes this section or a bylaw adopted under it is liable on conviction to a penalty not greater than $50.
A person is liable on conviction to a further penalty of $5 for every further week during which the violation continues.
A penalty under subsection (5) or (6) is a charge on the real property of the person convicted, and may be imposed, collected and recovered in the manner provided for taxes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special fire protection powers

bcl:text.#text: Subject to the  and the regulations under that Act, a board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorize the fire chief to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: enter on property and inspect premises for conditions that may cause a fire, increase the danger of a fire or increase the danger to persons or property from a fire,
take the measures described in the bylaw to prevent and suppress fires, including the demolition of buildings and other structures to prevent the spreading of fire, and

bcl:text.#text: exercise some or all of the powers of the fire commissioner under section 25 of the , and for these purposes that section applies;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require the owners or occupiers of real property to remove from a building or yard anything that, in the opinion of the fire chief, is a fire hazard or increases the danger of fire;

bcl:text: if property is endangered by debris caused by a lumbering, land clearing or industrial operation, require the person who is carrying on or who has carried on the operation, or the owner or occupier of the land on which the debris exists, to
as directed by the bylaw or by the fire chief;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dispose of the debris, and
undertake any other actions for the purpose of removing or reducing the danger

bcl:text.#text: deal with any matter within the scope of the  in a manner not contrary to that Act or the regulations under it.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority of the fire chief under a bylaw under subsection (1) may be exercised by a person under the authority of the fire chief or by another person designated in the bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Health protection authority

bcl:text.#text: Subject to the , a board may, by bylaw,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate and prohibit for the purposes of maintaining, promoting or preserving public health or maintaining sanitary conditions, and
undertake any other measures it considers necessary for those purposes.

bcl:text.#text: Section 9  of the  applies to a bylaw under subsection (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As a further limit on subsection (1), a board must not fluoridate the water supply unless the bylaw has received the assent of the electors.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special drainage and sewerage authority
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate and prohibit the design and installation of drainage and sewerage works provided by persons other than the regional district, and
require owners of real property to connect their buildings and structures to the appropriate sewer or drain connections in the manner specified in the bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Watercourse may be included in drainage system
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, make a watercourse part of the regional district drainage system, whether the watercourse is on private land, on regional district land or on a highway.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Works for controlling drainage

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if a board

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: considers that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the drainage of surface water from outside the regional district into or through an area inside the regional district should be prevented, diverted or improved, or
drainage of or from an area in the regional district should be prevented, continued beyond the regional district, diverted or improved, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: proposes to undertake works for these purposes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before undertaking the proposed works, notice must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: given to any other local government whose area may be affected, and
served on all owners of land that may be affected.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The notice under subsection (2) must state

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the place in the regional district where details of the project may be inspected, and
the date by which objections to the project must be received by the regional district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The date under subsection (3) (b) must be at least one month after the date on which the notice is given under subsection (2).
On application, the Supreme Court may order that the notice under subsection (2) (b) may be served by substituted service in accordance with the order.
The designated regional district officer must make a full report to the inspector on all objections received.
On the application of a board, the minister may authorize works proposed under this section on the terms of compensation and cost to owners of land affected that the minister considers proper.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Remedial authority in relation to drainage and dikes

bcl:text.#text: Division 12  of Part 3  of the  applies to regional districts in relation to matters referred to in section 75  of that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Highway construction and dikes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a dike is crossed by a highway or private road, the level of the dike must not be interfered with.
If the top of a dike forms a portion of a highway, it is the duty of the board

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to maintain the dike at a constant level, and
to repair all injury directly or indirectly caused to the dike by its use as a highway.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, a board's duty under subsection (2) is limited to the highway as a highway and, except as otherwise required, does not extend to or include repair or maintenance of the dike as distinct from the highway.
As an exception, subsection (2) does not apply if the board has granted a diking commission the privilege of using the existing road for a dike.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Watercourse agreements between neighbouring jurisdictions
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board may make agreements with adjoining municipalities or regional districts, and also with the owner of any land, through, on or in which runs a natural stream or watercourse, for one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: constructing, enlarging or maintaining a culvert, ditch, flume, embankment or other work;
removing obstructions from the stream or watercourse to lessen or prevent the danger of flooding from it;

the granting, expending or accepting of money for the purposes referred to in paragraphs (a) and (b), even though the work may not be located in the municipality or regional district granting, expending or accepting the money or entering into the agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements respecting drainage works

bcl:text.#text: In this section and section 313,  has the same meaning as in section 1 (1) of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish requirements that must be met by owners of dikes, and
establish requirements that must be met by persons undertaking the construction of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dikes,
works to maintain the proper flow of water in a stream, ditch, drain or sewer in the regional district, or
works to reclaim or to protect part of the land mass of the regional district from erosion by action of the sea or a stream or from any other cause.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Appropriation of stream channel or bed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of constructing works referred to in subsection (2), a board may appropriate the land that constitutes the channel or bed of a stream that passes through the regional district, without compensation to the owner.
The power under subsection (1) may be exercised in relation to one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: dikes;
works to maintain the proper flow of water in a stream, ditch, drain or sewer in the regional district;
works to reclaim or to protect part of the land mass of the regional district from erosion by action of the sea or a stream or from any other cause;
works to protect all or part of the banks of the stream from erosion or damage;
works to make a watercourse part of the regional district drainage system, whether the watercourse is on a highway, regional district land or private land;
works through, under or over land adjoining a highway to protect the highway from damage by water.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before exercising the power under subsection (1), the board must, by bylaw, define the channel or bed of the stream.

A certified copy of every bylaw under subsection (3), together with a plan showing the channel or bed of the stream as defined in the bylaw, must be filed in the land title office of the district in which the land affected is located.

bcl:text.#text: section 307 ;
section 308 ;
section 311 ;

section 313 .
In addition, the following authorities of a regional district are subject to the applicable provisions of the :

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authority to acquire, manage, extend and remove

bcl:text.#text: works to maintain the proper flow of water in a stream as defined in the , ditch, drain or sewer in the regional district,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: dikes, or

bcl:text.#text: works to reclaim or to protect part of the land mass of the regional district from erosion by action of the sea or a stream as defined in the , or any other cause;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authority to regulate a wharf, dock, warehouse or slip owned, held or managed by the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Management of solid waste and recyclable material

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, establish the service of the regulation, storage and management of municipal solid waste and recyclable material, including the regulation of facilities and commercial vehicles used in relation to these matters.

bcl:text.#text: If a board adopts a bylaw under subsection (1), the board has and must exercise its authority in accordance with the  and regulations under that Act.
For the purposes of this section,  and  have the same meaning as in the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority in relation to waste disposal and recycling
bcl:section.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require persons to use a waste disposal or recycling service, including requiring persons to use a waste disposal or recycling service provided by or on behalf of the regional district;
require owners or occupiers of real property to remove trade waste, garbage, rubbish and other matter from their property and take it to a specified place;
require the emptying, cleansing and disinfecting of private drains, cesspools, septic tanks and outhouses, and the removal and disposal of refuse from them.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority requires animal control service

bcl:text.in:desc: [peace officer authority in relation to dangerous dogs]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 322 , this Division applies to a regional district only if the regional district provides a service in relation to animal control.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General animal control powers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate or prohibit the keeping of dogs, horses, cattle, sheep, goats, swine, rabbits or other animals and define areas in which they may be kept or may not be kept;
require that the owner, possessor or harbourer of a dog, or any class of dog, must keep it, as the bylaw directs,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: effectively muzzled while at large or on a highway or public place, or
on leash or under control of a competent person while on a highway or public place.

bcl:text.#text: For the purpose of subsection (1),  does not include any animal that the board did not have authority to regulate in respect of, or prohibit the keeping of, under section 703 of the , R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 323, as it read immediately before its repeal and replacement by the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dog licensing requirements

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting section 318 (1), a bylaw under that provision may regulate the keeping of dogs by requiring persons who own, possess or harbour a dog to hold a licence for the dog.
A bylaw referred to in subsection (1) may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require a separate dog licence for each dog, and
vary the amount of the fee according to the sex, age, size or breed of the dog.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A dog licence issued under this section is for the calendar year in which the licence is issued.
If a fee is imposed for a dog licence, the board may, by bylaw,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide for the payment of compensation, on a scale set out in the bylaw, to the owner of any domestic animal that is killed or injured by a dog over the age of 4 months, the owner of which is unknown and, after diligent inquiry, cannot be found, and
provide for the maximum total amount that is available in any one year for the purposes of compensation under this subsection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Animal pounds
bcl:section.bcl:text: The board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide for the seizure, impounding and detention of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: unlicensed dogs, and

bcl:text.#text: animals referred to in section 318 (1) (a)  that are unlawfully at large;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish, maintain and operate facilities as pounds;
regulate and establish the fines and fees, including damages for trespassing on private property, to be levied and collected by pound keepers;
provide for the sale or destruction of animals impounded if the fines, fees and other charges are not paid within a reasonable time.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Dangerous dogs

bcl:text.in:desc: [special powers in relation to dangerous dogs]
bcl:text.#text: The board may designate a person as an animal control officer as defined in section 49  of the , and, if the board does so, that section applies to the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Peace officer authority in relation to dangerous dogs

bcl:text.#text: Whether or not this Division applies to a regional district under section 317 , a peace officer may exercise authority under section 49 of the  within the boundaries of the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authority requires regional district service
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division applies to a regional district only if it provides a service in relation to the control of pollution, nuisances, pests, noxious weeds, noise, unsightly premises, unwholesome or noxious materials, odours and disturbances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Noise control

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: regulate or prohibit the making or causing of noises or sounds in or on a highway or elsewhere in the regional district

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that disturb, or tend to disturb, the quiet, peace, rest, enjoyment, comfort or convenience of the neighbourhood or of persons in the vicinity, or
that the board considers are objectionable or liable to disturb the quiet, peace, rest, enjoyment, comfort or convenience of individuals or the public;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prevent or prohibit persons from shouting, using megaphones and making other noise in, at or on streets, wharves, docks, piers, steamboat landings, railway stations or other public places;
prevent charivaries and similar disturbances of the peace.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations and prohibitions under subsection (1) (a) may be different for different areas of the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Nuisances and disturbances
bcl:section.bcl:text: The board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prevent, abate and prohibit nuisances, and provide for the recovery of the cost of abatement of nuisances from the person causing the nuisance or other persons described in the bylaw;
prohibit persons from

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: causing or permitting water, rubbish or noxious, offensive or unwholesome matter to collect or accumulate around their premises, or
depositing or throwing bottles, broken glass or other rubbish in any open place;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of preventing unsightliness on real property,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: prohibit persons from placing graffiti on walls, fences or elsewhere on or adjacent to a public place, and
prohibit the owners or occupiers of real property from allowing their property to become or remain unsightly;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of remedying unsightliness on real property, require the owners or occupiers of real property, or their agents, to remove from it unsightly accumulations of filth, discarded materials, rubbish or graffiti;
require the owners or occupiers of real property, or their agents, to clear the property of brush, trees, noxious weeds or other growths;
require the owners or occupiers of real property, or their agents, to prevent infestation by caterpillars and other noxious or destructive insects and to clear the property of such insects;
in relation to the emission of smoke, dust, gas, sparks, ash, soot, cinders, fumes or other effluvia,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: require the owners or occupiers of real property, or their agents, to eliminate or reduce the fouling or contaminating of the atmosphere through those emissions,
establish measures and precautions to be taken for the purpose of subparagraph (i), and
establish limits not to be exceeded for those emissions;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require manufacturers and processors to dispose of the waste from their plants in the manner directed by the bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fireworks restrictions

bcl:text.#text: Subject to the , the board may, by bylaw, regulate or prohibit the sale or disposal to any person of firecrackers and other fireworks of every nature or kind.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Bylaw authority in relation to business regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, regulate in relation to business under

bcl:text.#text: Divisions 1  and 3  of Part 2 of the , and
Division 9  of Part 3 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The making of a bylaw under subsection (1) is subject to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the regulations made under subsection (3), and

bcl:text.in:desc: [Restrictions in Relation to the Passenger Transportation Act]
bcl:text.#text: Division 5.1  of Part 3 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation, establish restrictions, conditions or requirements relating to the regulation of business under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Removal and deposit of sand, gravel and other soil

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a regional district only if the regional district provides a service in relation to the control of the deposit and removal of soil and the control of the deposit of other materials.

bcl:text: The board may, by bylaw, regulate or prohibit
any land in the regional district or in any area of the regional district.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the removal of soil from, and
the deposit of soil or other material on

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw under subsection (2) may make different regulations and prohibitions for different areas.

bcl:text.#text: Section 9  of the  applies to a provision in a bylaw under subsection (2) that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prohibits the removal of soil, or
prohibits the deposit of soil or other material and that makes reference to quality of the soil or material or to contamination.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:text: require the holding of a permit for
any land in the regional district or in any area of the regional district;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the removal of soil from, or
the deposit of soil or other material on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: impose rates or levels of fees for a permit referred to in paragraph (a);
impose rates or levels of fees for the activities referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Fees under subsection (5) (b) or (c) may vary according to the quantity of soil removed or the quantity of soil or other material deposited, and the rates or levels of fees may be different for different areas of the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fire and security alarm systems

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a regional district only if the regional district provides a service in relation to the regulation of fire alarm systems and security alarm systems.
The board may, by bylaw, do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require permits for the operation of these systems and establish fees for these permits;
establish fees to be paid

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the owner or occupier of real property to which services are provided by or on behalf of the regional district in response to a false alarm of a system, or

by the persons who lease or otherwise provide these systems to the owners or occupiers of real property if services referred to in subparagraph (i) are provided in response to a false alarm of a system;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide that a fee under paragraph (b) (i), if unpaid, may be added to and form part of the taxes payable on the real property as taxes in arrear;
exercise powers given by regulation under subsection (4);
establish exemptions from the application of a bylaw under this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A fee under subsection (2) (b) may vary in relation to the number of occasions on which services referred to in that subsection are provided.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: grant additional powers to regional districts and the City of Vancouver to enact bylaws establishing specified prohibitions, restrictions, requirements and conditions regarding

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: fire alarm systems and security alarm systems, and
the installation, operation, maintenance and repair of these systems, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: authorize specified variations of the provisions of bylaws under paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As an exception, a bylaw under this section does not apply to fire alarm systems that are intended to alert only the occupants of the dwelling unit in which they are installed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: House numbering

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a regional district only if the regional district provides a service in relation to the numbering of buildings.
The board may, by bylaw, require owners or occupiers of real property to place building or structure numbers assigned by the regional district in a conspicuous place.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulation of signs and advertising

bcl:text.#text: Subject to the , a board may, by bylaw, regulate the erection, placing, alteration, maintenance, demolition and removal of a sign, sign board, advertisement, advertising device or structure, or any class of them.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of subsection (1), a board may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: classify structures, things and the whole or a portion of a highway, and
make different regulations for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: different zones established under a zoning bylaw, and
different classes of highways and portions of them.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regional district irrigation services

bcl:text.#text: Section 638  applies to regional districts.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Regional Districts: Service Structure and Establishing Bylaws

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General authority for services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the specific limitations and conditions established under this or another Act, a regional district may operate any service that the board considers necessary or desirable for all or part of the regional district.
The authority under subsection (1) includes the authority to operate a service in an area outside the regional district as well as in the regional district itself.
A regional district service may be operated directly by the regional district or through another public authority, person or organization.

If a regional district has established works or facilities outside the regional district for the purposes of a regional district service, the board may, by bylaw, regulate and prohibit the use of the works and facilities.
If a board enters into a mutual aid agreement respecting the use of equipment and personnel, those uses may be undertaken inside or outside the service area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consent required for services outside regional district

bcl:text.#text: Before establishing a service referred to in section 332 (2) , the board must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: obtain the consent of the other affected local government in accordance with subsection (2) of this section, and
after receiving that consent, obtain the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the consent required by subsection (1) (a),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the area is in a municipality, the consent of the municipal council is required, and
if the area is not in a municipality, the consent of the regional district board for the area is required.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, in an approval referred to in subsection (1) (b), establish restrictions and conditions on the establishment and operation of a service in a participating area that is outside the regional district.
Subject to an approval under subsection (3), if a service referred to in subsection (1) is established,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the area outside the regional district must be identified as a separate participating area for the service,
the powers, duties and functions of the regional district extend to the participating area as if it were located in the regional district, and
the provisions of this Part and other former Part 24 provisions apply with respect to the participating area as if it were located in the regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Services to public authorities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a regional district makes an agreement with a public authority to provide services to or for the public authority that are within the powers of the public authority, the entire cost of providing the service under the agreement is a debt owed to the regional district by the public authority.
A service provided under an agreement referred to in subsection (1) may be provided inside the boundaries of another regional district if that other regional district consents.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Authorities in relation to services other than regulatory services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw in relation to a regional district service, other than a regulatory service, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make different provisions for different areas, times, conditions or circumstances as described by bylaw,
establish different classes of persons, places, activities, property or things, and
make different provisions, including exceptions, for different classes established under paragraph (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, regulate and prohibit in relation to a regional district service other than a regulatory service.

Without limiting subsection (2), a bylaw under that subsection may provide for a system of licences, permits or approvals in relation to a regional district service, including by doing one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prohibiting any activity or thing until a licence, permit or approval has been granted;
providing for the granting and refusal of licences, permits and approvals;
providing for the effective periods of licences, permits and approvals;
