bcl:text: establishing
a licence, permit or approval, or providing that such terms and conditions may be imposed, the nature of the terms and conditions and who may impose them;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: terms and conditions of, or
terms and conditions that must be met for obtaining, continuing to hold or renewing

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing for the suspension or cancellation of licences, permits and approvals for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: failure to comply with a term or condition of a licence, permit or approval, or
failure to comply with the bylaw;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing for reconsideration or appeals of decisions made with respect to the granting, refusal, suspension or cancellation of licences, permits and approvals.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Referendums regarding services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board may, by bylaw, provide for a referendum in the whole or a part of one or more municipalities or electoral areas to obtain the opinion of the electors on a question regarding a service that is or that may be operated by the regional district.

bcl:text.#text: Section 344  applies to a referendum under this section as if the areas in which the referendum is to be conducted were proposed participating areas.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Petitions for electoral area services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The owners of parcels in an electoral area may sign and submit to the regional district a petition for a service in all or part of that electoral area.
Each page of a petition referred to in subsection (1) must do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe in general terms the service that is proposed;
define the boundaries of the proposed service area;
indicate in general terms the proposed method for recovering annual costs;
contain other information that the board may require.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In order for a petition to be certified as sufficient and valid for the purposes of this section,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the petition must be signed by the owners of at least 50% of the parcels liable to be charged for the proposed service, and
the persons signing must be the owners of parcels that in total represent 50% of the net taxable value of all land and improvements within the proposed service area.

bcl:text.in:desc: [rules in relation to petition for local area service]
bcl:text.#text: Section 212 (4) to (6)  of the  applies to a petition under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Establishing bylaws required for most services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, in order to operate a service, the board must first adopt an establishing bylaw for the service in accordance with this Division.
As exceptions, a bylaw under this section is not required to establish the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: general administration, other than electoral area administration;
electoral area administration;
the undertaking of feasibility studies in relation to proposed services;

bcl:text.#text: a service under section 4 (1)  of the ;
the undertaking of a referendum under section 336 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a local community commission under section 243;
a service that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a service for which authority is expressly provided by a provision of this Act that is not a former Part 24 provision, and
is not a regulatory service;

bcl:text.#text: the giving of grants to an applicant for a business promotion scheme under section 215  of the  in relation to a mountain resort;

bcl:text.in:desc: [appointment of regional district and islands trust approving officers]
bcl:text.#text: if the regional district board is authorized to appoint an approving officer under section 77.1  of the , services related to the approving officer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Required content for establishing bylaws

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An establishing bylaw for a service must do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe the service;
define the boundaries of the service area;
identify all municipalities and electoral areas that include participating areas for the service;

bcl:text.#text: indicate the method of cost recovery for the service, in accordance with section 378 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: set the maximum amount that may be requisitioned for the service by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: specifying a maximum amount,
specifying a property value tax rate that, when applied to the net taxable value of land and improvements in the service area, will yield the maximum amount, or
specifying both a maximum amount and a property value tax rate as referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), in which case the maximum amount is whichever is greater at the applicable time.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As exceptions, the requirement of subsection (1) (e) does not apply to an establishing bylaw for the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a regulatory service;
coordination, research and analytical services relating to the development of the regional district;
social planning services;
the promotion of economic development;
programs in preparation for emergencies;
emergency communication systems;
regional parks and regional trails;
services related to heritage conservation;

bcl:text.#text: participation in a regional library district under Part 3  of the ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [general administration, electoral area administration, feasibility studies and regional hospital district services]
bcl:text.#text: a service referred to in section 338 (2) (a) to (d) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an establishing bylaw covers more than one service, it must separately indicate the matters under subsection (1) for each service.

bcl:text.#text: If the board adopts an establishing bylaw for a service referred to in section 338 (2) (a) , the establishing bylaw must identify all municipalities and all electoral areas in the regional district as participating areas for the service, and the service area is the entire regional district.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special options for establishing bylaws

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An establishing bylaw for a service may do one or more of the following:

bcl:text.#text: set out the method of apportionment of costs among the participating areas, if this is to be different from the method established by section 380 (2) (a) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [number of votes per director in respect of administration and operation of services]
bcl:text.#text: in relation to resolutions and bylaws respecting the administration and operation of the service, establish the method for determining the number of votes to which a director is entitled if this is to be different from that otherwise established by section 209 (1) (b) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the administration and operation of the service is to be delegated to a body established by the board, provide for appointments to the body and establish voting rules for the body in relation to the service;

bcl:text.in:desc: [minimum participation time before service review can be initiated]
bcl:text.#text: provide a time period for the purposes of section 357 (1) (a)  that is less than the period established by that provision;
provide an alternative review process that is different than the service review process established by Division 6 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish terms and conditions for withdrawal from the service;
include any other provisions respecting the establishment and operation of the service that the board considers appropriate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As a restriction on subsection (1) (b), each director for a participating area must be entitled to at least one vote.

If a proposed establishing bylaw includes provisions referred to in subsection (1) (f), each participant must consent to the provisions before the bylaw is submitted for participating area approval under section 342.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special rules in relation to continuation of older services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: means a service provided by a regional district immediately before the transition date;
means the authority to provide services under section 775 (3) to (8) of the , R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 323, as that section read immediately before the transition date;
means August 30, 2000, being the date on which section 774.2 of the , R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 323, came into force.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, a regional district continues to have the power to provide a continued service as follows:

bcl:text: if, immediately before the transition date,
the service may be continued in accordance with the previous continuation authority and, for these purposes, that authority is deemed not to have been repealed;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the service is one that was authorized under the previous continuation authority, and
no bylaw that was deemed under the previous continuation authority to be an establishing bylaw has been adopted in relation to the service,

bcl:text: if the service
the service may be continued without an establishing bylaw.

bcl:text.#text: is one referred to in section 339 (2) (b) or (c) , or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is another service for which an establishing bylaw was not required before the transition date,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a board exercises a power to provide a continued service under subsection (2), it may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adopt a bylaw in accordance with subsection (5) to convert the service to one exercised under the authority of an establishing bylaw, and
by the same bylaw, amend the power to the extent that it could if the power were in fact exercised under the authority of an establishing bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board must adopt a bylaw under subsection (3) in relation to a continued service if changes are made to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the service area;
the municipalities, electoral areas or treaty first nations participating in the service;
the method of cost recovery;
the apportionment of costs in relation to the service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw under subsection (3) must

bcl:text.#text: meet the requirements of section 339  for an establishing bylaw, and
be adopted in accordance with section 349  as if it were a bylaw amending an establishing bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw under subsection (3) is deemed to be an establishing bylaw for the service in respect of which it is adopted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Approval of establishing bylaws

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An establishing bylaw has no effect unless, before its adoption, it receives

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the approval of the inspector, and
participating area approval in accordance with this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Participating area approval under this section may be obtained as follows:

bcl:text.#text: in any case, by assent of the electors in accordance with section 344 ;
if permitted under section 345 (1) , approval given in accordance with that section;

bcl:text.in:desc: [consent on behalf of municipal participating area]
bcl:text.#text: if permitted under section 346  for a proposed municipal participating area, consent given in accordance with that section;
if permitted under section 347 (1)  for a proposed electoral participating area, consent given in accordance with that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless authorized under subsection (4), participating area approval must be obtained separately for each participating area in the proposed service area.

If approval is to be obtained under subsection (2) (a) or (b), the board may, by resolution adopted by at least 2/3 of the votes cast, provide that the participating area approval is to be obtained for the entire proposed service area.

in:desc: [services for which establishing bylaw not required — general administration, electoral area administration and regional hospital district services]
bcl:text.#text: As an exception, subsections (1) to (4) do not apply to an establishing bylaw for a service referred to in section 338 (2) (a), (b) or (d)  and, instead, section 349  applies to the bylaw as if it were a bylaw amending an establishing bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Responsibility for obtaining approval

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If participating area approval is to be obtained for the entire service area,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the board may choose the method,
in the case of approval by alternative approval process, the board is responsible for obtaining the approval, and
in the case of approval by assent of the electors, at the option of the board,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the board is responsible for conducting the voting throughout the proposed service area, or
the board and councils are responsible for conducting the voting in the same manner as under subsection (2), with the results of the voting in these areas added together.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If participating area approval is to be obtained separately for each participating area,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (3), for a municipal participating area, the council may choose the method and is responsible for obtaining the approval, and
for an electoral participating area, the board may choose the method and is responsible for obtaining the approval.

bcl:text: If, within 30 days after third reading of the establishing bylaw, a council
the board may adopt a resolution under section 342 (4) to have participating area approval obtained for the entire service area.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has notified the regional district that it is refusing to seek participating area approval, or
fails to give any notice to the regional district with respect to how participating area approval is to be obtained,

in:desc: [consent on behalf of municipal participating area]
bcl:text.#text: Despite section 57 (1) , if a council is authorized to give consent on behalf of the electors in accordance with section 346  but does not exercise this authority, the municipality is responsible for the costs of obtaining the participating area approval.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Approval by assent of the electors

bcl:text.#text: Participating area approval through assent of the electors under Part 4  is obtained if,
in the case of approval under section 342 (3) , for each proposed participating area, a majority of the votes counted as valid is in favour of the bylaw, or
in the case of approval under section 342 (4) , a majority of votes counted as valid is in favour of the bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the case of approval under section 342 (4), for the purposes of determining who is entitled to vote under section 172, the voting area is deemed to be all the proposed participating areas.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Approval by alternative approval process

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Participating area approval may be obtained by alternative approval process if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the maximum amount that may be requisitioned for the service is the amount equivalent to 50¢ for each $1 000 of net taxable value of land and improvements included in the service area;
the bylaw relates to a service for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the collection, conveyance, treatment or disposal of sewage,
the supply, treatment, conveyance, storage or distribution of water, or
the collection, removal or disposal of solid waste or recyclable material.

bcl:text.#text: In addition to the information required by section 86 (2)  of the , the notice of an alternative approval process under this section must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of the bylaw, or
a synopsis of the bylaw that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: describes in general terms the intent of the bylaw,
describes the proposed service area, and
indicates the date, time and place for public inspection of copies of the bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consent on behalf of municipal participating area
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a proposed participating area is all of a municipality, the council may give participating area approval by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: consenting on behalf of the electors to adoption of the proposed bylaw, and
notifying the board of its consent.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consent on behalf of electoral participating area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For a proposed electoral participating area, the board may authorize participating area approval to be given under this section

bcl:text.#text: if the board receives a sufficient petition under section 337 , or
in the case of an establishing bylaw for a service referred to in section 339 (2) , if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the participating area includes all of the electoral area, and
the service can be established without borrowing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Participating area approval under this section may be given by the electoral area director consenting in writing to adoption of the bylaw.

If a director refuses to give consent under subsection (2), the board may, by a resolution adopted by at least 2/3 of the votes cast, dispense with the consent of the electoral area director and give participating area approval by consenting to adoption of the bylaw on behalf of the electors in the proposed participating area.

If a board consents under subsection (3), the director for the participating area may, within 14 days after the resolution, appeal to the minister for a review, and the minister may, after that review, order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that the consent of the board under subsection (3) stands,

bcl:text.#text: that participating area approval must be obtained under section 344 , or
that participating area approval must be obtained under section 345 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Other procedural rules

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a board proposes to borrow money for the start of a service, the establishing bylaw and the loan authorization bylaw must, for the purposes of obtaining participating area approval, be dealt with as if they were one bylaw.
The regional district corporate officer must file with the inspector a copy of each establishing bylaw after it has been adopted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amendment or repeal of establishing bylaws

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to an order under subsection (4) or (5), an establishing bylaw may be amended or repealed, at the option of the board,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in accordance with the requirements applicable to the adoption of the bylaw that it amends or repeals, or
with the consent of at least 2/3 of the participants.

in:desc: [consent on behalf of municipal participating area]
[consent on behalf of electoral participating area]
bcl:text.#text: Sections 346  and 347 (2) to (4)  apply to consent under subsection (1) (b) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw amending or repealing an establishing bylaw has no effect unless it is approved by the inspector.

The minister may order that a bylaw amending or repealing an establishing bylaw may be adopted only in accordance with the requirements applicable to the adoption of the bylaw that it repeals or amends.

bcl:text: In addition to the requirement under subsection (1) or (4), as applicable, the minister may order that, before the bylaw is adopted, it must receive the approval of the electors

bcl:text.#text: obtained in accordance with section 344  or 345 , as specified by the minister.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in one or more specified participating areas, or in specified parts of one or more participating areas, or
in the entire service area,

bcl:text.in:desc: [minister may waive requirement for elector assent or approval]
bcl:text.#text: Section 137 (2)  of the  does not apply to a bylaw amending or repealing an establishing bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The regional district corporate officer must file with the inspector a bylaw amending or repealing an establishing bylaw after it has been adopted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Changes to participating and service areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A bylaw amending an establishing bylaw may provide for changes to the boundaries of a service area, including merging 2 or more service areas.

If a bylaw amending an establishing bylaw extends an existing service to a new participating area, the proposed participating area must be included as a participating area and the participant for the proposed participating area must be included as a participant for the purposes of section 349.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amending bylaws that are needed for authority to borrow

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if either of the following is required in order to borrow money for a service:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a bylaw amending an establishing bylaw;

bcl:text.in:desc: [conversion of pre-2000 service to establishing bylaw service]
bcl:text.#text: a conversion bylaw under section 341 (3) .

Subject to an order under subsection (3), the amending or conversion bylaw referred to in subsection (1) and the loan authorization bylaw may, for the purposes of obtaining participating area approval under Division 4 , be dealt with as if they were one bylaw.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may order that participating area approval of the amending or conversion bylaw referred to in subsection (1) must be obtained separately from the approval of the loan authorization bylaw.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special provisions respecting service withdrawal

bcl:text.#text: If a bylaw adds, amends or repeals provisions of an establishing bylaw referred to in section 340 (3) , each participant must consent to the changes before the bylaw is submitted for approval in accordance with the requirements of section 349 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a bylaw repealing an establishing bylaw is submitted to the inspector for approval and the inspector is not satisfied that all participants in a service have reached agreement respecting the termination of a service, the inspector must refer the matter to the minister, who must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: direct the participants and the board to undertake negotiations on the matters related to terminating the service, or
if the minister is satisfied that agreement under paragraph (a) is unlikely, direct that the parties proceed to mediation or arbitration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may specify the length of time that negotiations under subsection (2) (a) must continue and may extend this time period before or after it has expired.
The participants and board must conduct negotiations under subsection (2) (a) in good faith, making reasonable efforts to reach an agreement that will permit resolution of the matters.
If the parties have not reached agreement by the end of the time period for negotiations under subsection (2) (a), the minister must direct that the parties proceed to mediation or arbitration.
For the purposes of subsections (2) (b) and (5), subject to any regulations under subsection (7),

bcl:text.#text: sections 362 to 372  apply as if this were a service withdrawal under Division 6  of this Part, and
section 356  applies as if this were a service review process under that Division.

The minister may make regulations respecting mediation and arbitration under this section, including regulations providing exceptions to or modifications of a provision referred to in subsection (6) or a regulation under section 372 .

bcl:division.bcl:text: Dispute Resolution in Relation to Services

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions in relation to this Division
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Division:

bcl:text.#text: means the establishment of the terms and conditions for withdrawal from a service by an arbitrator's decision under
section 366 , or

bcl:text.in:desc: [direction to further arbitration in certain cases]
bcl:text.#text: section 368 ;
means a participant who gave notice under

bcl:text: as applicable;

bcl:text.#text: section 357 , or
section 361 ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [initiating participant decision to proceed with withdrawal]
bcl:text.#text: means notice under section 367 (1) (d) (i) ;
means a review of participation in one or more services in accordance with the process under sections 357 to 360;
means proposed withdrawal from participation in one or more services in accordance with the process under sections 361 to 372.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister may appoint facilitators

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may appoint facilitators for the purposes of this Division, whose responsibilities are to monitor service reviews and service withdrawals, and to assist the parties in reaching agreement in those processes, by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: facilitating negotiations,
facilitating resolution of issues, and
assisting in setting up and using mediation or other non-binding resolution processes.

bcl:text.#text: On receiving a notice under section 357  or 361 , the minister may designate a person appointed under subsection (1) as the facilitator responsible to assist the parties in relation to the matter.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (4), at any time during a service review or service withdrawal, the facilitator designated under subsection (2) is to provide the assistance described in subsection (1) if requested to do so by a party.
The authority for the facilitator to provide assistance in relation to a service withdrawal ends at the time an arbitration referred to in section 366 begins.

Once a facilitator becomes involved under this section, the parties must provide information as requested by the facilitator and must otherwise cooperate with the facilitator in fulfilling the facilitator's responsibilities.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Parties to a service review or service withdrawal

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The parties to a service review or service withdrawal are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the initiating participant,
any other participant in the service, and
the board.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The representatives for the parties to a service review or service withdrawal are the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a municipal participating area,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a council member appointed by the council, or
if no appointment is made, the mayor;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an electoral participating area, the director of the electoral area;
in the case of the board,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a director appointed by the board, or
if no appointment is made, the chair.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board and any municipal participant may make an appointment referred to in subsection (2) and, if this is done, must notify the other parties as to the person who is to be their representative in the service review or service withdrawal.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Costs of service review or service withdrawal

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Costs incurred by a party in respect of their own participation in a service review or service withdrawal may be recovered only as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of costs incurred by a municipal participant, the costs must be recovered from the municipal participating area on the same basis as other costs of the service are recovered from that participating area;

in the case of costs incurred by an electoral area participant, the costs are deemed to be costs of the service and must be recovered from the participating area on the same basis as other costs of the service are recovered from that participating area;

in the case of costs incurred by the board, the costs are deemed to be costs of the service and must be apportioned and recovered from the service area on the same basis as other costs of the service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless otherwise agreed by the parties to a service review or service withdrawal or, in the case of arbitration, unless otherwise directed by the arbitrator, the following are deemed to be costs of the service and must be recovered in accordance with subsection (3):

bcl:text.#text: the fees of any mediator or arbitrator engaged to conduct or participate in the process, other than the fees of a facilitator under section 354 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the administrative costs of the process, other than costs incurred by the parties in respect of their own participation in the process;
any other costs with respect to the service review or service withdrawal that are not costs referred to in subsection (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The costs to be recovered under subsection (2) must be assigned, apportioned and recovered as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service review that dealt with only one service, the costs must be apportioned between and recovered from the participating areas on the same basis as other costs of the service;
in the case of a service review that dealt with more than one service, the costs must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: be assigned proportionally between the services under review at the time those costs were incurred, on the basis of the relative expenditures provided for the services in the previous year's financial plan, and
for each service, be apportioned and recovered in accordance with paragraph (a);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service withdrawal that dealt with only one service, subject to a regulation under subsection (4), the costs must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: be assigned proportionally between the service area and the participating area for the initiating participant, on the basis of the converted value of land and improvements in those areas,
for costs assigned to the service area, be apportioned and recovered in accordance with paragraph (a), and
for costs assigned to the initiating participant, be recovered on the same basis that other costs of the service are recovered from the participating area;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service withdrawal that dealt with more than one service, subject to a regulation under subsection (4), the costs must

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: be assigned proportionally between the services under review at the time those costs were incurred, on the basis of the relative expenditures provided for the services in the previous year's financial plan, and
for each service, be assigned, apportioned and recovered in accordance with paragraph (c).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing how costs are to be assigned under subsection (3) (c) and (d) in cases where there is more than one initiating participant.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Initiating a service review

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A participant may initiate a service review under this Division if all the following circumstances apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the participant has been a participant in the service for at least 5 years or, if applicable, the shorter time period provided in the establishing bylaw for the service;
the service has not been subject to a service review that was initiated within the past 3 years;
the establishing bylaw does not include provisions under section 340 (1) (e) establishing an alternative review process;
the participant considers that the terms and conditions of participation in the service are unsatisfactory.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: To initiate a service review, a participant must give written notice to the board, all other participants in the service and the minister.
The notice under subsection (2) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe the terms and conditions of participation in the service that the participant finds unsatisfactory,
give reasons, relating to those terms and conditions, as to why the participant wishes to initiate the service review, and
describe how the participant has previously attempted to resolve the issues.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A participant who wishes to initiate service reviews for more than one service must give separate notice under this section for each service.

In the case of a service review in relation to the exercise of authority under letters patent, the minister may determine what is to be considered a separate service under that authority for the purposes of this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Other issues and services may be dealt with in one service review

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following issues may be addressed by a service review:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the issues raised by the notice under section 357;
any other issue respecting the service raised by a party at a preliminary meeting under section 359;
if the other parties agree, an issue respecting the service raised by a party after the preliminary meeting.

bcl:text: In addition to the issues under subsection (1), if
the service reviews may be combined and dealt with in the same service review.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at the same time or after the service review is initiated, another service review is initiated by notice under section 357 in respect of the same or another service,
the other parties to the initial service review agree, and
any participants in the other service who are not parties to the initial service review also agree,

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Preliminary meeting

bcl:text.#text: Within 120 days after receiving a notice under section 357 , the board must arrange a preliminary meeting of all party representatives for the purpose of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reviewing the terms and conditions of the service, and

bcl:text: establishing a negotiation process for addressing
with a view to reaching an agreement on the negotiation process and the issues to be addressed in the negotiations.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the issues raised in the notice, and
any other issues raised by a party during the meeting,

bcl:text.#text: If a facilitator has been designated under section 354 , the board must give notice of the preliminary meeting to the facilitator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The requirement for a meeting under subsection (1) does not apply to a service review that is combined under section 358 with another service review that was previously initiated.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Negotiations to resolve issues

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 60 days after the preliminary meeting under section 359 was convened, or the first such meeting was convened if there is more than one, the parties must begin negotiations for the purpose of reaching agreement on the relevant issues.
All parties must negotiate in good faith, making reasonable efforts to reach an agreement respecting the issues being addressed in the service review.

bcl:text.#text: At any time after receiving a notice under section 357 , the minister may specify a time period within which the parties must conclude negotiations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may extend a time period established under subsection (3) before or after it has expired.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Initiating service withdrawal

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A participant may initiate service withdrawal if all the following circumstances apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the service has been subject to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a service review that was initiated within the past 3 years, or
an alternative review process, in accordance with establishing bylaw provisions under section 340 (1) (e), that was started within the past 3 years;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the first meeting respecting the review, which in the case of a service review is the first preliminary meeting under section 359, was convened more than 8 months ago;
the service is not

bcl:text.in:desc: [services for which no establishing bylaw required]
bcl:text.#text: a service referred to in section 338 (2) ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a regulatory service, or
a service prescribed under subsection (6).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A participant may initiate service withdrawal under this Division even if the establishing bylaw provides terms and conditions for withdrawal under section 340 (1) (f).
To initiate service withdrawal, a participant must give written notice to the board, all other participants in the service and the minister.
The notice under subsection (3) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: describe the terms and conditions of participation in the service that the participant finds unsatisfactory, and
give reasons, relating to those terms and conditions, as to why the participant wishes to withdraw from the service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite Divisions 3 to 5 of this Part or the establishing bylaw, at any time after receiving a notice under subsection (3) of this section, the minister may determine that a part of the service must be considered a separate service for the purposes of sections 362 to 372.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations excluding services from withdrawal under this Division.
Regulations under subsection (6) may be different for different regional districts and different circumstances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister's direction on process

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After receiving a notice under section 361, unless the matter is to be dealt with in another service withdrawal under section 363, the minister must do one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the establishing bylaw provides an alternative review process and the minister considers that agreement may be reached by a service review under this Division, terminate the service withdrawal and direct the parties to engage in a service review;
direct the parties to engage in further negotiations respecting continued participation in the service, specifying a time period within which the parties must conclude negotiations;
direct the parties to engage in negotiations respecting the terms and conditions for withdrawal, specifying a time period within which the parties must conclude negotiations;
direct the parties to engage in mediation under section 365 respecting the terms and conditions for withdrawal, specifying a time period within which the mediation must be concluded;
if satisfied that agreement is unlikely under paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d), direct that the terms and conditions for withdrawal from the service be resolved by arbitration under section 366.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may extend a time period established under subsection (1) (b), (c) or (d) before or after it has expired.
If no agreement is reached from negotiations under subsection (1) (b) within the applicable time period, the minister must take one of the actions set out in subsection (1) (c) to (e).

If no agreement is reached from negotiations under subsection (1) (c) within the applicable time period, the minister must direct the parties to engage in mediation or arbitration in accordance with subsection (1) (d) or (e).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Addition of further initiating participants or further services

bcl:text.#text: If, at the same time or after a service withdrawal is initiated, the minister receives another notice under section 361  respecting the same or any other service of the same regional district,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service withdrawal that is in negotiation under section 362 (1) (c) or mediation under section 365, the minister may direct that the matter be dealt with as part of the initial service withdrawal, and

in the case of a service withdrawal that is in arbitration under section 366, the minister must refer the matter to the arbitrator, who may direct that it be dealt with as part of the initial service withdrawal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before making a direction under subsection (1), the minister or arbitrator must consult with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the parties in the initial service withdrawal,
if applicable, the mediator, and
if applicable, any participants in the other service who are not parties to the initial service withdrawal.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Early termination of process
bcl:section.bcl:text: A service withdrawal may be ended at any stage of the process

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by agreement between the parties,

bcl:text.#text: if there is only one notice under section 361  in respect of the process, at the option of the initiating participant, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if there is more than one notice under section 361 in respect of the process, by agreement between the initiating participants.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Mediation in relation to service withdrawal

bcl:text.#text: If mediation is directed under section 362 (1) (d) , the mediator must be selected

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by agreement between the parties, or
if the minister considers that the parties will not be able to reach agreement, by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The mediation is to be a process of negotiation by the parties, undertaken with the assistance of a neutral and impartial person, for the purpose of reaching a mutually acceptable resolution of the relevant issues.
The mediator must give notice to the minister when the mediation is concluded.

Subject to subsection (5), if agreement on the terms and conditions for withdrawal is not reached during the mediation or within 60 days after the mediation is concluded, the terms and conditions for withdrawing from the service must be resolved by arbitration under section 366.
The minister may extend the time period under subsection (4) before or after it has expired.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Arbitration in relation to service withdrawal

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If agreement in relation to service withdrawal cannot otherwise be reached under this Division, the terms and conditions for withdrawal must be resolved before a single arbitrator by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: final proposal arbitration in accordance with subsection (4), or
full arbitration in accordance with subsection (5).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The choice of process under subsection (1) (a) or (b) is to be determined by agreement between the parties but, if the minister considers that they will not be able to reach agreement, the minister must direct which procedure is to be used.
The arbitrator is to be selected from a list prepared by the minister in consultation with the Union of British Columbia Municipalities, and is to be selected

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by agreement between the parties, or
if the minister considers that the parties will not be able to reach agreement, by the minister.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to any regulations under section 372, the following apply to final proposal arbitration under this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the arbitrator must conduct the proceedings on the basis of a review of written documents and written submissions only, and must determine each disputed issue by selecting one of the final written proposals submitted by the parties respecting that issue;

bcl:text.#text: in making a determination under paragraph (a), the arbitrator must consider any terms and conditions established under section 340 (1) (f) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the terms and conditions for service withdrawal must be resolved by the arbitrator after incorporation of the final proposals selected under paragraph (a) in respect of each issue;
no written reasons are to be provided by the arbitrator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to any regulations under section 372, the following apply to full arbitration under this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the arbitrator may conduct the proceedings at the times and in the manner the arbitrator determines;
the arbitrator must consider any terms and conditions referred to in section 340 (1) (f);
the terms and conditions for service withdrawal must be resolved by the arbitrator, who is not restricted in a decision to submissions made by the parties on the disputed issues;

for an arbitration involving more than one initiating participant, the final resolution may establish different terms and conditions for service withdrawal depending on which participants decide to withdraw under the final resolution;
the arbitrator must give written reasons for the decision.

bcl:text.#text: The  does not apply to arbitration under this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Initiating participant must respond to final resolution

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within one year after final resolution under section 366 or a longer time established under subsection (2) of this section, each initiating participant must do one of the following and must notify the minister and board as to whichever applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: agree to continue as a participant on the current terms and conditions;
agree with the board and the other participants on new terms and conditions for continued participation in the service;
agree with the board and the other participants on terms and conditions for withdrawal that differ from the final resolution;
seek approval in accordance with subsection (4) of this section regarding withdrawal from the service in accordance with the final resolution and, as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: if that approval is obtained and the participant decides to proceed with withdrawal, agree to withdraw from the service in accordance with the final resolution, or
if that approval is not obtained, or the approval is obtained but the participant decides not to proceed with withdrawal, agree to continue as a participant on the current terms and conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may extend the time period under subsection (1) before or after it has expired.

If the board and the participants do not adopt the bylaws and take the other actions required to implement an agreement referred to in subsection (1) (b) or (c) within the applicable time period under subsection (1), the initiating participant is deemed to have given notice of continuation under subsection (1) (a) unless it has given notice of withdrawal before the end of that period.
Approval required under subsection (1) (d) is obtained by one of the following:

bcl:text.#text: assent of the electors in the participating area in accordance with section 344 ;
in the case of a service referred to in section 345 (1) , by approval in accordance with that section;

bcl:text.in:desc: [consent on behalf of municipal participating area]
bcl:text.#text: in the case of a municipal participating area that is all of the municipality, consent given on behalf of the electors in accordance with section 346 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the service withdrawal is related to more than one service,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approval must be sought in respect of all services considered together, which are deemed to be a single matter requiring approval,
approval under subsection (4) (b) may be used only if each of the services are services referred to in section 345 (1) (a) or (b), and
approval under subsection (4) (c) may be used only if the municipal participating area for each of the services is all of the municipality.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Direction to further arbitration in certain cases

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must direct that a new arbitration under section 366 be undertaken, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a service withdrawal involved more than one initiating participant,
only some of the initiating participants give notice of withdrawal, and

bcl:text.#text: the final resolution does not include applicable provisions under section 366 (5) (d) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of arbitration under subsection (1), the participants who gave the notice of withdrawal are deemed to be the initiating participants.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: When final resolution becomes binding
bcl:section.bcl:text: A final resolution becomes binding on all parties as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service withdrawal involving only one initiating participant, if the initiating participant gives notice of withdrawal, the final resolution becomes binding when that notice is given;

in the case of a service withdrawal involving more than one initiating participant, if all initiating participants give notice of withdrawal, the final resolution becomes binding when the last of these notices is given;

bcl:text: in the case of a service withdrawal involving more than one initiating participant, if

the applicable provisions of the final resolution become binding when all of the initiating participants have given notice under section 367 (1) (a) or (d) or at the end of the time period under that section, whichever is earlier.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: one or more initiating participants give notice of withdrawal, and

bcl:text.#text: the final resolution includes applicable provisions under section 366 (5) (d) ,

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Implementation of final resolution by bylaw

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board and the participants must adopt the bylaws and take the other actions required to implement the terms and conditions of a final resolution within 90 days after it becomes binding under section 369.
Despite any other provision of this Act, approval of the electors is not required for a bylaw referred to in subsection (1).
The minister may extend the time period under subsection (1) before or after it has expired.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Failure to adopt required bylaws

bcl:text.#text: If the board or a municipal participant does not adopt the bylaws required under section 370 , on the recommendation of the minister, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by order, implement the terms and conditions of the final resolution.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An order under subsection (1) is deemed to be a bylaw of the applicable local government.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations respecting arbitrations

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may make regulations respecting arbitrations under this Division and, without limiting this, may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting matters that an arbitrator must or may consider;
respecting the authority of an arbitrator to resolve the terms and conditions for withdrawing from a regional district service;
respecting the authority of an arbitrator to require the cooperation of local governments and electoral area directors in relation to the arbitration.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations under this section may be different for

bcl:text.in:desc: [direction to further arbitration in certain cases]
bcl:text.#text: final proposal arbitration, full arbitration and arbitration directed under section 368 ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: different regional districts, and
different circumstances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fiscal year and accounting for services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The fiscal year for a regional district is the calendar year.

The regional district financial officer must keep separate financial records for each service that include full particulars of assets and liabilities, revenues and expenditures, information concerning reserve funds and other pertinent financial details.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Annual financial plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regional district must have a financial plan that is adopted annually, by bylaw, by March 31.
For certainty, the financial plan may be amended by bylaw at any time.
The planning period for a financial plan is 5 years, that period being the year in which the plan is specified to come into force and the following 4 years.
The financial plan must set out the following for each year of the planning period, shown separately for each service:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the proposed expenditures for the service;
the proposed funding sources for the service;
the proposed transfers between funds in respect of the service.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For any year, the total of the proposed expenditures and transfers to other funds in respect of a service must not exceed the total of the proposed funding sources and transfers from other funds for the service.
The proposed expenditures for a service must set out separate amounts for each of the following as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount required to pay interest and principal on regional district debt;
the amount required for capital purposes;
the amount required for a deficiency referred to in subsection (11);
the amount required for other purposes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The proposed funding sources for a service must set out separate amounts for each of the following as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: revenue from property value taxes;
revenue from parcel taxes;
revenue from fees and charges;
revenue from other sources;

bcl:text.#text: proceeds from borrowing, other than borrowing under section 404 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The proposed transfers between funds in respect of a service must set out separate amounts for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reserve funds, and
accumulated surplus.

bcl:text.in:desc: [assistance other than under a partnering agreement]
bcl:text.#text: As a limit on expenditures, the amounts that may be included in a financial plan as expenditures respecting assistance to be apportioned under section 380 (2) (g)  must not, in total, exceed the amount that would be obtained by a tax of 10¢ per $1 000 on the net taxable value of land and improvements in the regional district.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As a limit on revenues,

bcl:text.#text: if section 339 (1) (e)  applies in relation to a service, the total of the amounts included under subsection (7) (a) and (b) of this section for the service must not exceed the maximum amount set under section 339 (1) (e), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the total of the amounts requisitioned in respect of the service under the following must not exceed the amounts included under subsection (7) (a) and (b):

bcl:text.in:desc: [tax base, requisition and collection of funds for treaty lands]
bcl:text.#text: section 257 ;
section 385 ;
section 387 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If actual expenditures and transfers to other funds in respect of a service for a year exceed actual revenues and transfers from other funds in respect of the service for the year, the resulting deficiency must be included in the next year's financial plan as an expenditure for the service in that year.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Public process for development of financial plan

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A board must undertake a process of public consultation regarding the proposed financial plan before it is adopted.
The designated regional district officer must send a copy of the financial plan to each municipality in the regional district and to the inspector.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Annual reporting on regional district finances

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On or before June 30 in each year, a regional district must hold a board meeting or other public meeting for the purpose of presenting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the audited financial statements of the preceding year, and

in:desc: [reporting of council remuneration, expenses and contracts]
bcl:text.#text: the report under section 168  of the  as it applies under section 377  of this Act.
Notice of the meeting must be published in accordance with section 94  of the  and must include the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date, time and, if applicable, place of the meeting;
if the annual meeting is to be conducted by means of electronic or other communication facilities, the way in which the meeting is to be conducted by those means;
a statement that the financial statements and any reports to be presented at the meeting are available for inspection at the regional district offices.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A copy of the financial statements and reports must be available for public inspection at the regional district offices during their regular office hours from the time the notice under subsection (2) is given until June 30 in the following year.

bcl:text.#text: The following provisions of the  apply to regional districts:
section 167 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [reporting of council remuneration, expenses and contracts]
bcl:text.#text: section 168 ;
section 183 ;
Division 2  of Part 6 ;
Division 4  of Part 6;
Division 5  of Part 6.
In relation to the application of Division 4 of Part 6 of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provisions apply as though each service were the only service provided by the regional district,
all accounting and other matters relating to a reserve fund must be kept separate for each service, and

in:desc: [reserve fund used in relation to expropriation or damage to property]
bcl:text.#text: a board may adopt a bylaw under section 189 (3)  of the  in relation to compensation in respect of property expropriated or injured or to carry out works referred to in section 291  of this Act, but only with the approval of the inspector.

bcl:text.in:desc: [use of money in a reserve fund for the purposes of another reserve fund]
bcl:text.#text: Despite subsection (2) (a) and (b), section 189 (4.1) and (4.2)  of the  applies to reserve funds established by a board for capital purposes for the same service or for different services.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Options for cost recovery

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regional district may recover the costs of its services by one or more of the following:

bcl:text.#text: property value taxes imposed in accordance with Division 3 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to subsection (2), parcel taxes imposed in accordance with Division 3;

bcl:text.#text: fees and charges imposed under section 397 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: revenues raised by other means authorized under this or another Act;
revenues received by way of agreement, enterprise, gift, grant or otherwise.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Parcel taxes may not be used to recover all or part of the costs of a regulatory service.

In the case of a service for which an establishing bylaw is required, if all or part of the costs are to be recovered by one or more of the methods referred to in subsection (1) (a) to (c), the establishing bylaw must indicate which methods are to be used.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Costs of services

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: All costs incurred by a regional district in relation to a service, including costs of administration attributable to the service, are part of the costs of that service.

bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the amount required by a board
is deemed to be costs of the service out of which the action arose.

bcl:text.#text: for a payment authorized under section 740 ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to satisfy a judgment or other order of a court against the regional district, or
to satisfy an award or other order of an arbitrator against the regional district

bcl:text.#text: If the legal action or other proceeding arose from the negligence of the board, the amount is deemed to be costs of the service referred to in section 338 (2) (a) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a regional district undertakes a service after conducting a feasibility study in respect of the service, the costs of that study are deemed to be costs of that service.

bcl:text.#text: If a referendum under section 336  is limited to all or part of the service area for an existing service, the costs of the referendum are deemed to be costs of the service.

For the purposes of apportionment under this Division and requisition under Division 3 , the costs of providing a service are deemed to be the costs that are to be recovered by means of property value taxes or parcel taxes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Apportionment of costs

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the establishing bylaw sets the method for apportioning the costs of providing a service, those costs must be apportioned among the participating areas in accordance with the bylaw.

If the method of apportionment is not set by establishing bylaw, the costs of providing a service must be apportioned on the basis of the converted value of land and improvements in the service area as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if there is an establishing bylaw but it does not set out the method of apportionment, among the participating areas for the service;

if there is no establishing bylaw and the method of apportionment is not otherwise set under this or another Act, among all the municipalities and electoral areas participating in the service, with the service area deemed to be the entire regional district;
in the case of electoral area administration,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: subject to subparagraph (ii), among all the electoral areas, with the service area deemed to be all the electoral areas, and

if the board provides that some or all of the costs are to be apportioned among the electoral areas that the board considers benefit from the administration, those costs must be apportioned among those electoral areas, with the service area deemed to be all those electoral areas;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of feasibility studies in relation to proposed services, if no service is established and the board provides that the costs are to be apportioned among the electoral areas, among all the electoral areas, with the service area deemed to be all those electoral areas;

bcl:text.in:desc: [appointment of regional district and islands trust approving officers]
bcl:text.#text: in the case of services related to an approving officer, if the board is authorized to appoint the approving officer under section 77.1  of the , among all the electoral areas, with the service area deemed to be all those electoral areas;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a service that is in relation to a regional growth strategy for an area that is less than the entire regional district, among the areas for which the regional growth strategy is initiated or adopted, with the service area being all those areas;

bcl:text.#text: in the case of assistance under section 263 (1) (c) , other than assistance under a partnering agreement referred to in section 274, at the option of the board,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with paragraph (b) of this subsection, or
among the municipalities or electoral areas benefiting from the assistance, with the service area deemed to be all those areas;

bcl:text.#text: in the case of a referendum under section 336  that is not limited to all or part of the service area for an existing service, among the municipalities and electoral areas in which the referendum is held, with the service area deemed to be all those areas;
in the case of a local community commission under section 243 , entirely from the local community, with the service area deemed to be that local community;
in the case of a business improvement area under section 215  of the  in relation to a mountain resort, entirely from that area, with the service area deemed to be the business improvement area;
in the case of services under Part 14 , in accordance with section 381 .

bcl:marginalnote.#text: Cost sharing for services under Part 14

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The costs of services under Part 14 must be apportioned on the basis of the converted value of land and improvements in the service area as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if no municipality has entered into an agreement under subsection (2) or opted out under subsection (3), among all the municipalities and electoral areas, with the service area deemed to be the entire regional district;

subject to paragraphs (c) and (d), if one or more municipalities have opted out under subsection (3) and are no longer participating in the services, among the electoral areas and any municipalities that have not opted out, with the service area deemed to be those areas;

if one or more municipalities have entered into an agreement under subsection (2) to share only some of the costs, those costs are to be recovered in accordance with the agreements and the remaining costs are to be apportioned among the other municipalities and electoral areas participating in the services;

if a municipality is liable for costs under subsection (6) or (7), those costs are to be recovered from the municipality and the remaining costs are to be apportioned among the other participating municipalities and electoral areas.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The board and a municipality may enter into an agreement that the municipality is to share in some but not all of the costs of services under Part 14, to the extent set out in the agreement and in accordance with the terms and conditions for the municipality's participation established by the agreement.

Subject to subsection (4), a municipality may opt out of participation in services under Part 14 by giving notice to the board, before August 31 in any year, that until further notice it will no longer share the costs of services under Part 14.
A municipality that is a party to an agreement under subsection (2) may give notice under subsection (3) only in the last year of the term of the agreement.
After notice is given under subsection (3), the municipality ceases to participate in the services, effective at the start of the following year.

As an exception to subsection (5), if a municipality that is not a party to an agreement under subsection (2) gives notice under subsection (3) after a board has passed a resolution authorizing the preparation of an official community plan or bylaw under Part 14, the municipality continues to participate in the services and must share the costs in that preparation until the earlier of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the plan or bylaw is adopted;
2 years after the date the resolution is passed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (6) also applies to a municipality that is a party to an agreement under subsection (2) if the official community plan or bylaw is in relation to the Part 14 services for which the municipality shares costs under the agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Property under creditor protection may be excluded from apportionment

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: means the value of an eligible property determined by using the valuation basis described in the method of apportionment for the applicable eligible service;

means property located within the service area of an eligible service that is owned or occupied by an insolvent person who is liable for property value taxes or parcel taxes referred to in Division 3  with respect to that property;
means a regional district service with respect to which all or part of the method of apportionment is based on the assessed value, net taxable value or converted value of

bcl:text: or on a similar method of apportionment that uses property values;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: land,
improvements, or
land and improvements,

bcl:text.#text: means a person
who has filed for and been granted protection under the  (Canada),

who has filed an assignment or a proposal or a notice of intention to make a proposal under the  (Canada) or against whom a bankruptcy order or an order appointing an interim receiver has been made under that Act,
in respect of whom a winding-up order has been made under the  (Canada) based in whole or in part on the person being insolvent, or
who has made an application to the administrator under section 5 of the  (Canada) and who has been found by the administrator to be eligible to make that application.
Despite sections 380  and 381 , the board may, on an annual basis, exclude the determined value of an eligible property from the apportionment for an eligible service.

In order to be effective for the current year, an exclusion under subsection (2) must be made before the requisitions in respect of the eligible service for that year are sent to municipalities under section 385  and to the Surveyor of Taxes under section 387 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Valuation information and apportionment adjustments

bcl:text: As soon as practicable after the relevant information is available, the British Columbia Assessment Authority must provide to the designated regional district officer and to the inspector
in each municipality, electoral area and participating area.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the net taxable value of land and improvements, and
the converted value of land and improvements

bcl:text: If, in respect of a year,
the share of the cost apportioned to and borne by the municipalities and electoral areas must be adjusted in a manner directed by the minister in the next requisition after the adjustment.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: adjustments referred to in subsection (2) are made, and

the share of the cost of all the services of the regional district that was apportioned to and borne by a municipality or an electoral area in that year would, had those adjustments been taken into account, have increased or decreased by more than $1 000,

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax base for property value taxes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the case of a participating area for a service for which no establishing bylaw is required, property value taxes must be imposed on the basis of the net taxable value of land and improvements in the participating area.

In the case of a municipal participating area for a service for which an establishing bylaw is required, the establishing bylaw may provide that property value taxes must be imposed on the basis of one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assessed value of land and improvements in the participating area, other than land and improvements exempt from taxation for municipal purposes;
the assessed value of land in the participating area, other than land exempt from taxation for municipal purposes;
the assessed value of improvements in the participating area, other than improvements exempt from taxation for municipal purposes;
the net taxable value of land and improvements in the participating area;
the net taxable value of land in the participating area;
the net taxable value of improvements in the participating area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: As an exception to subsection (2), for a municipal participating area that is all or part of the City of Vancouver, property value taxes may be imposed on the basis set out in the establishing bylaw for the service.

If a board fails to exercise its authority under subsection (2) or (3), property value taxes must be imposed on the basis of the assessed value of land and improvements in the participating area, other than land and improvements exempt from taxation for municipal purposes.

In the case of an electoral participating area for a service for which an establishing bylaw is required, the establishing bylaw may provide that property value taxes must be imposed on the basis of one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the net taxable value of land and improvements in the participating area;
the net taxable value of land in the participating area;
the net taxable value of improvements in the participating area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a board fails to exercise its authority under subsection (5), property value taxes must be imposed on the basis of the net taxable value of land and improvements in the participating area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requisition of funds from municipalities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On or before April 10 in each year, the designated regional district officer must send to each municipality a requisition in respect of each service stating the amount required from the municipality for the service during the year.
An amount requisitioned under this section is a debt due by the municipality to the regional district, and the council must pay it to the board on or before August 1 of the current year.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Collection in municipalities

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a requisition is delivered to a municipality, the amount requisitioned must be collected by the municipality as follows:

bcl:text.#text: in the case of an amount to be recovered by means of a property value tax, by imposing the tax in accordance with Division 3  of Part 7 of the  using the tax base authorized under section 384  of this Act;
in the case of an amount to be recovered by means of a parcel tax, by imposing the tax in accordance with Division 4  of Part 7 of the .
Part 7  of the  applies for the purposes of taxation under this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a participating area is only part of a municipality, taxes under this section in respect of the service may be imposed only in the municipal participating area for the service.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requisition of funds for electoral areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On or before April 10 in each year, the designated regional district officer must deliver to the Surveyor of Taxes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a requisition in respect of each service, stating the amount required during the year in respect of each electoral participating area, and
that regional district officer's certification

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that the amount requisitioned is included in the financial plan for that year, and
of any other matter in relation to the requisition that is required to be certified under subsection (2).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations prescribing matters that must be certified under subsection (1) (b) and establishing requirements respecting such certifications.
The amounts requisitioned under this section may be paid by the Minister of Finance from the consolidated revenue fund.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Collection in electoral areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a requisition is delivered to the Surveyor of Taxes under section 387, the amount requisitioned must be collected by the Provincial government as follows:

bcl:text.#text: in the case of an amount to be recovered by means of a property value tax, by imposing the tax within the electoral participating areas in accordance with the , having due regard to the tax base authorized under section 384 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an amount to be recovered by means of a parcel tax, by imposing the tax on the appropriate parcels within the electoral participating areas, on the basis of the assessment roll under subsection (2) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a parcel tax is to be imposed under this section,

bcl:text.#text: the board must, by bylaw, provide for the preparation of a parcel tax roll for the service area, and for these purposes Division 4  of Part 7 of the  applies,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authenticated parcel tax roll for the tax must be forwarded to the Surveyor of Taxes before February 28 in each year, and

bcl:text.#text: the authenticated parcel tax roll is to be used as the basis for the tax, subject to any deletions required to reflect deletions from the supplementary roll used under the .

An amount to be recovered under this section must be imposed by the Provincial government as if it were a tax under the , and the provisions of that Act respecting assessment, levy, collection and recovery of taxes and the addition of penalty and interest on unpaid taxes apply to taxes imposed under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Grants in place of taxes to be paid over to regional district

bcl:text: The amount received by a municipality, by way of a grant in place of taxes for regional district purposes within the regional district,
must be paid to the board promptly after receipt.

bcl:text.#text: under the , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: from a Crown corporation or agency

bcl:link.in:doc: Payments in Lieu of Taxes Act

bcl:text.#text: On or before February 1 in each year, the amount received under the  (Canada) in the immediately preceding year

bcl:text: by way of a grant in place of taxes for regional district purposes within the regional district, must be paid to the board.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by a municipality, or
for an electoral area, by the Surveyor of Taxes,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An amount paid under subsection (1) or (2) must be applied proportionally to the accounts for the services in respect of which the grant is paid.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Variable tax rate system

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means a system under this section by which individual tax rates for a specific taxation year are determined and imposed for each property class to which the system applies.
Despite section 388  but subject to the regulations under this section, a board may, by bylaw, establish an annual variable tax rate system for a specified taxation year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A variable tax rate system

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may apply to tax rates only for one or more regional district services,
may vary tax rates only for property classes 2, 4 and 5, and
must not result in the ratios between the tax rate for a property class referred to in paragraph (b) and the tax rate for property class 1 exceeding either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the applicable ratio prescribed under subsection (6), if any, or

bcl:text.#text: the applicable ratio under section 20 (2)  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For each service subject to a variable tax rate system, the bylaw must set out the ratio between the tax rate for each property class subject to the system and the tax rate for property class 1.
A bylaw under subsection (2) must be approved by the inspector and, for this purpose, must be submitted to the inspector by January 31 in the taxation year for which it is to apply.
Subject to subsection (8), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting variable tax rate systems, including regulations doing one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing limits on tax rates;
prescribing ratios between the tax rate for a property class and the tax rate for property class 1;
prescribing formulas for calculating the limits or ratios referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations under subsection (6) may prescribe different tax limits, ratios or formulas in relation to one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: different property classes;
different regional districts;
different services;
different service areas;
different types of participating areas.

bcl:text.#text: A regulation under subsection (6) may not prescribe a ratio for the purposes of subsection (3) (c) that would exceed the applicable ratio established under section 20 (2)  of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Property tax exemptions

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Land and improvements owned or held by a regional district within the boundaries of the regional district are exempt from taxation when used for its own purposes, but otherwise are subject to taxation, as applicable,

bcl:text.in:desc: [taxation of municipal land used by others]
bcl:text.#text: under section 229  of the  as if the property were owned by a municipality, or
under section 18 (4)  of the  as if the property belonged to the Crown.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), the owner of land or improvements, or both, leased or rented to the regional district is liable for the payment of taxes that would otherwise be imposed with respect to that property under any Act.
On or before October 31 in any year, a board may, by bylaw adopted by at least 2/3 of the votes cast, exempt property described in subsection (4) from taxation under this Part

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the next calendar year, or
with the assent of the electors, for a specified period not longer than 10 years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following property that is in an electoral area may be exempted under subsection (3):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: land or improvements, or both, owned or held by, or held in trust by the owner for, an athletic or service organization and used principally for public athletic or recreation purposes;
