If an extension of time is granted under section 786 to a local government in relation to an area, the local government must give to the minister written notice as soon as practicable after the local government has adopted a zoning bylaw that complies with section 481.3 in relation to the area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — extension process for small-scale multi-family housing

bcl:text.#text: A local government may apply for an extension of time for the purposes of complying with section 481.3  in relation to an area that is subject to that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application under subsection (1) must contain the information required by the minister and must be submitted to the minister as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: unless paragraph (b) applies, on or before June 1, 2024;
in the case of extraordinary circumstances, on or before June 30, 2024.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may grant one or more extensions of time to the local government in relation to an area if the minister is satisfied that the local government is unable, by June 30, 2024, to comply with section 481.3 in relation to the area for any of the following reasons:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the local government is in the process of upgrading infrastructure that services the area;
the infrastructure that services the area is such that compliance by June 30, 2024 is likely to increase a risk to health, public safety or the environment in the area;
there exist extraordinary circumstances that otherwise prevent compliance in relation to the area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must give to the local government written notice of a refusal or an extension that includes,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a refusal, the date of the refusal, and
in the case of an extension, the date, which may not be later than December 31, 2030, by which compliance with section 481.3 is required in relation to the area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — ministerial order related to small-scale multi-family housing

bcl:text.#text: This section applies in relation to a local government if the minister is satisfied that the local government has failed, within the time required under this Act, to adopt a zoning bylaw that complies with section 481.3 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may give to the local government a notice that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: sets out the minister's objections to the local government's zoning bylaw, and
states that the local government must, within 30 days after receipt of the notice, alter the zoning bylaw accordingly.

bcl:text.#text: If the local government does not alter the zoning bylaw in accordance with the notice under subsection (2), the minister may, with the prior approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, make an order that enacts or amends a bylaw referred to in section 479  to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: permit, in relation to an area, the use and minimum density of use required to be permitted under section 481.3 and
establish the siting, size, dimension, location or type of housing units required to be permitted under section 481.3 in the area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In making an order under subsection (3), the minister may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish different classes of persons, property, circumstances, things and other matters,
make different provisions, including exceptions, for different classes referred to in paragraph (a), and

make different provisions, including exceptions, for different areas or different parts of areas of municipalities or regional districts or different persons, property, circumstances, things and other matters.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the date specified in an order made under subsection (3), the bylaw enacted or amended under the order is conclusively deemed to be enacted or amended by the local government in accordance with the order.
An order may not be made under subsection (3) after December 31, 2031.
For the purposes of this section, the minister has the powers of a local government under section 479 (1) (c).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — effect of official community plan

bcl:text.#text: Section 478 (2)  does not apply, before the prescribed date, in relation to a zoning bylaw adopted by a local government for the purpose of permitting the use or density of use required to be permitted under section 481.3 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — heritage revitalization agreements

bcl:text.#text: Section 610 (2.1)  does not apply to a heritage revitalization agreement, as defined in section 586 , entered into before the date this section comes into force.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Not in force
bcl:section.bcl:text: [Not in force.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — definition in relation to this Division

bcl:text.#text: In this Division,  has the same meaning as in section 455 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — interim designation of transit-oriented areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the recommendation of the minister, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations designating a transit-oriented area in respect of a local government.
A designation under subsection (1) must be made by incorporating in the regulation a map or plan or other graphic material.

As soon as practicable after a designation is made under subsection (1), written notice of the designation must be given to each municipality or regional district in respect of which a transit-oriented area is designated.

bcl:text.#text: If, in the manner contemplated by section 585.52 , a local government designates as a transit-oriented area an area that includes the same area designated under subsection (1) of this section, for the purposes of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the designation under subsection (1) ceases to have effect in relation to the area of overlap, and
the designation of the local government prevails over the designation under subsection (1) to the extent of any inconsistency.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A regulation may not be made under subsection (1) on or after June 30, 2024.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — provincial policy guidelines related to transit-oriented areas

in:desc: [provincial policy guidelines related to transit-oriented areas]
bcl:text.#text: Section 473 (4) , as it relates to applicable guidelines under section 585.5 , does not apply in relation to a proposed bylaw to adopt an official community plan that, on the date this section comes into force, has been given first reading.
Section 479 (6)  does not apply in relation to a proposed zoning bylaw that, on the date this section comes into force, has been given first reading.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — effect of official community plan

in:desc: [restrictions on zoning authority in relation to transit-oriented areas]
bcl:text.#text: Section 478 (2)  does not apply, before the prescribed date, in relation to a zoning bylaw adopted by a local government for the purpose of complying with section 481.01 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — restrictions on zoning authority in relation to transit-oriented areas

bcl:text.in:desc: [restrictions on zoning authority in relation to transit-oriented areas]
bcl:text.#text: Section 481.01  does not apply in relation to an application for an amendment to a zoning bylaw if, on the date this section comes into force, the proposed bylaw that would amend the zoning bylaw has been given first reading.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — off-street parking

bcl:text.#text: If, on the date this section comes into force, a bylaw of a local government requires an owner or occupier of any land in a transit-oriented area, or of any building or other structure on the land, to provide off-street parking spaces for the residential use of the land, building or other structure, other than off-street parking spaces for use by disabled persons, the local government must, by the prescribed date, adopt a bylaw that complies with the restriction in section 525.1 (1) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 525.1 does not apply in relation to an application for an amendment to a zoning bylaw if, on the date this section comes into force, the proposed bylaw that would amend the zoning bylaw has been given first reading.
